text: This pharmacy used to be wonderful. Customer service has gone downhill, and their attitude even worse. They now don't notify you if your doctor denies a refill and requests you contact them to discuss. Apparently, you're supposed to just get annoyed and after a few days miraculously KNOW to call the pharmacy to find this out. Wasted time waiting. Then I told the person I would be moving to a new pharmacy because of this shoddy experience (one of many, but the last straw). She said, "That's fine!" This is where I used to get all of my groceries. Clearly Publix doesn't care. I'm not only moving pharmacies, I will now shop elsewhere for everything. Bye Publix.

name: Kelly Davis
text: Go to pick up a prescription and they are never ready. Always an excuse- sorry, we had to order it, sorry, it didn't come in, sorry, the insurance says it won't refill until tomorrow (after the pharmacy tech TOLD me the refill date). Never a phone call telling me there is a problem. This happens at least twice a month. Sorry, I'll tell my manager. Yeah, right. How about learning to use a phone? Looks like it's time to find a new pharmacy for next year.

name: Shawn Argo
text: My granddaughter needed some medication filled. The pharmacy not only didn’t have it in stock, but didn’t bother to order the medicine since she’s on Medicaid and they said it wasn’t covered, come to find out it IS COVERED and assumed we wouldn’t buy it at cost. In addition they didn’t call to inform us of their decision. My granddaughter has had to suffer because of their incompetence. Never going back to this pharmacy or STORE again! I honestly believe this pharmacy does not have the customers’ best interests at heart and are in it for their own gain. Doctors take an oath to do no harm, guess pharmacists at Publix don’t take an oath!

name: Michael 69
text: Always prompt and very friendly thank you

name: Brittani Miesner
text: Never have I ever had been handled in a timely manner here. The lines are forever long! There are clearly plenty of pharmacy techs around filling prescriptions out. But the drive-thru line is always so long & I normally wait 30-40 mins. I get that it’s a 4-6 o’clock rush, but that’s ridiculous! I don’t bother wasting my time going inside when there have been numerous occasions where they haven’t filled my prescription when they said they would. Or that they have been out of stock & didn’t bother to tell me. If there was a Walgreens nearby my house, I’d switch in a heartbeat!

name: Cheyanne Childress
text: Said my medicine would be ready in 20 minutes came back and said it would be another 30 minutes i swear they are so slow i wouldnt recommend them i would go to target pharmacy or the piggly wiggly pharmacy so much faster and they are nicer these people are rude.

name: Heather Dumdey
text: Worst pharmacy ever. Staff especially the main pharmacist are rude. You go in and they'll ignore you as they carry on their own personal conversations. They mess up on medication. State they cant fill certain prescriptions for whatever reason but I can take them to other places and they fill them just fine. Tonight was my final straw they did not give my daughter all of her medicine and i had to go all the way back up there just to get it fixed. They didnt bother to apologize or anything it was almost as if I inconvenienced them. Go over to mills pharmacy down the street they are way better and always friendly.

name: Seth Alexander
text: Took in my prescription. The lady was a total weirdo about it like I was trying buy something I wasn't prescribed. Refused GoodRX. It was like she kept coming up with excuses not to fill it.

name: Casey Benefield (Think A Little)
text:
So... I was talking to the lady, asking about Vitamin D, whether or not they received the prescription from my doctor, and she flat out hung up on me. I wasn't even arguing, so I have no idea why.

So I mentioned it when I was there in person picking up Synjardy. She just said "oh well, you're here now," and never cared to deal with the prescription Vitamin D...

Seriously, treat some folks with dignity. You can swing a cat and find pharmacies at every corner. I was trying to give Publix another chance after problems back in 2012 (Publix's fault) that landed me in the ER while I waited for them to run a prescription properly. Never received an apology.

name: Andrea
text: Great programs for medication when not insured.

name: Brink DeBoer
text: Discriminated againat my 5 year old for having medicaid and assumed that her prescription couldn't be paid for because of her insurance. Didnt bother to order it or inform me of the situation. Whole staff standing around doing nothing the entire wait only to tell me my child cannot get her medicine. Then refused to send it to another pharmacy...literally the worst people I have ever met. I want them to look my little girl in the eyes and tell her she doesn't deserve her medicine because they assumed she came from a poor family.

name: Sharon Chambers
text: They made CVS look good this evening. Horrible

name: jimmy weathers
text: The people working in the pharmacy were very rude and condescending.i even asked for the pharmacist and she was rude also.i will never use their pharmacy again. They even had someone else’s prescription in my bag when I went to pick up my prescription.i worry they could poison some one

name: Devin Matthews
text: Always love the staff here

name: Rene' Howell
text: Good customer service

name: Melissa Howell
text: Pricey,

name: Mike Kelly
text:
It was great when Dr. Daughtery was there. I have hemochromatosis(iron overload) and he was very knowledgeable of the condition and how to treat it. Blood letting(donations) are the way to get rid of excess iron and requires more frequent letting than Lifesouth or Red Cross allow without doctor's orders. For some undisclosed reason Dr. Daughtery is not there now so I had to see another doctor last year at NWACC. Not only did he restrict how often I could give blood to once every 3 months(regular donations can be done every 55 days) by written orders but his office never got the orders to LifeSouth. Since them I've had to try and get an appointment with someone elsewhere. In the meantime my iron continues to climb. I managed to get an appointment for June 7th elsewhere(that took 2 months) but on June 1st I came down with symptoms of Covid and tested positive on the 4th. Had to postpone and they tell me it will be August before the next opening.

Now I'm stuck living with the random debilitating cramps in my leg and foot that are always present when my ferritin(levels of iron stored in the body) is elevated.

If you are considering this place for Hemochromatosis go somewhere else.

PS- the other place I had an appointment with? They requested my records from NWACC and, from my understanding, still hadn't received them as of June 4th. How is that for competence?

name: Scott Mason
text: Always The Nicest And Best Care Here From Very Knowledgeable Oncologist's And Nurses ! They Have Always Been The Best To Me At Both Their Locations ! I Wouldn't Go Anywhere Else ! Thank You NWA Cancer Center ! ❤️❤️❤️

name: Jennifer Berry
text: Signing in on line was nice. The front desk staff was so friendly to everyone that walked up. The nurse who triaged me was very kind. The NP that took care of me was knowledgeable, answered questions, and made the experience less stressful. Very satisfied.

name: Caitlin Seahorn
text: We came in at 7:30, right before closing, and we were the only patients there. The staff did not show any sign of any frustration. They were quick to assist me and allowed my husband to do what he could for me. The NP kept me talking to get my mind off my migraine and without realizing, it actually helped. She recommended a pharmacy right down the road since it was after hours and would be easier to get than the pharmacy I listed. Both ladies were super friendly; I’ve never had such a great interaction when I was in such pain.

name: Kei Bottoms
text: It's nice to be able to hold your spot from your phone, and enter all of the necessary information before heading out. You still have to wait some from time to time, but nothing compared to just walking in. Front lady is always very nice, she listens to you well and gives you what you need. I can tell how busy she can be, yet she is very very patient and polite. Entire staff is very nice group of ladies. Highly recommended.

name: Carolyn Holt
text: I am a veteran and the Muscle Shoals location is approved for urgent care needs of veterans when we can't get into our outpatient clinic fast. Upon arrival, I gave the receptionist the info she needed to make sure I am approved for care thru the VA. This poor lady was on the phone for close to 45 min trying to get the information she needed on a reference number. She was transfered to other numbers, only to be disconnected. She was literally my guardian angel towards the VA to get me seen. At one point, I even offered to pay the costs and "argue" with the VA on my own. She refused to let me pay out of pocket expenses for my visit because I was a veteran. I was so touched by her help and determination. Unfotunately, I don't know her name, but because of her kindness, I will always give this clinic high reviews to anyone who listens. To that receptionist: YOU ROCK and THANK YOU!!!

name: Melissa Scofield
text: They do a great job!  Very nice staff and they know what they’re doing. Highly recommend.

name: Taylor Boston
text: I have visited this facility a couple different times, and overall have had a good experience every time. I went yesterday and saw the NP, who is always great. I left very pleased, and even got on and left a good review. Today, I retract that good review. I understand they are busy, and it’s a crazy time. Yet, things were told to me by the front desk on the phone on one call, and then I was told “I am putting words in her mouth” and had a nice little argument on a separate call. I will not put the whole situation on here, unnecessary, but I just am not pleased with what happened. I work in healthcare, and usually do not complain about bad experiences, because everyone has bad days. Just felt like something needed to be said.

resp.text: Taylor, we regret you had a negative experience while in our care, especially after several good ones. We strive to ensure every patient receives an exceptional experience, every time. We appreciate your feedback as we would like to address your concerns and improve where we can. Please contact us directly at info@hhurgentcare.org to discuss your experience further.

name: Sandra B
text: Very friendly staff! My in and out time was amazing.... shortest visit I\'ve ever had while getting excellent care. Would highly recommend

name: Michael Charpentier
text: Fast and efficient. No hassle health-care. An oasis in the maze of finding quality care. Thank you Courtney 😊

name: John kyler
text: Here I was delivering to a local business. Started rushing around to get things done because it was Friday evening and I didn't want anyone to stay longer than needed. Welp it ended up that I got a nasty injury on a finger. The crew at Huntsville got me right in and had me fixed up good. The staff was very professional, caring and friendly. Whether it's a dust storm or a virus. They got it covered!

resp.text:
John,
We are sorry you hurt yourself but glad we were able to get you taken care of. Thanks for choosing us and thanks for the great review!

name: Kendal Crowell
text: I have always hated going to the doctor, however, the office staff and the practitioner, Courtney, made me feel so comfortable and welcome. They took good care of me and made COVID-19 testing not bad at all. I will definitely be coming back here when I need healthcare in the future.

resp.text: Thanks for your feedback and 5-star review! We appreciate it.

name: Baron C
text: Extremely friendly, professional and courteous staff. The entire staff was very knowledgeable and made my visit quick and easy.

resp.text: Thank you for the review.

name: Bill Beard
text: Very poor service.  I pre-set an oppointment for 9:45, I arrived early and waited for over 3 hours to see a nurse.  I will never come here again.

resp.text:
Bill,
We are sorry you did not have a good experience due to the extensive wait at our center. We appreciate feedback and use it to improve where we can. Please contact us directly at: info@hhurgentcare.org and someone will reach out to you shortly.

name: Rachel Walls
text: From the super friendly office staff to the amazing Nurse practitioner I had a wonderful experience.  I love the way they are constantly spraying Lysol to help with the spread of germs!!  Nurse Practitioner, Erica Hogeland was awesome. She is easy to talk to and very knowledgeable of my condition. I will defiantly recommend them to my family and friends!

resp.text: Thanks for this great review and recommendation. We are here to help!

name: JulieAnnShultz
text: The staff was so sweet with our 2 year old today. It was 15 minutes until closing and we came in with a broken arm. They took their time and gave her the best care! 100% recommend this clinic!

resp.text: Thanks

name: Tracy
text: The NP and other staff provided quick and competent care . I will definitely return for any urgent care needs

resp.text: Thanks!

name: Ella Cannon
text: The ladies who took care of me were super nice and professional. If you ever need blood work done go here and ask for Haley. I have always feared getting my blood drawn but I barley felt it at all!!! Thanks ladies for being so awesome.

name: Laurie Lane
text: This place is great! I cannot stand going to the doctor. The staff here is super friendly and helpful. The facilities are clean and modern. Highly recommend!

resp.text: We appreciate your business and thank you for leaving a 5-star review. Come back and see us when you need to.

name: Chad Thompson
text: Absolutely Amazing Experience! Super Friendly Receptionist, The Nurse Practitioner Was Excellent! Made us feel cared about, and like a family oriented atmosphere! Highly Recommended!!

resp.text: Thanks so much for your recommendation and great review!

name: Katie Holt
text: Unfortunately we have had to visit this urgent care several times since Christmas because of sickness, but I wouldn't dare go anywhere else in the Shoals when we need a quick visit. Everyone I have met on their staff is very friendly and helpful.  Ms. Pennington, CRNP is my favorite to see. She is very nice and seems to be genuinely concerned about our health.

resp.text: Thank you for the review. We are glad we've been able to help.

name: Morgan McCullar
text:
The best advice I can give is DO NOT go here. I went in this morning because I had a sore throat and runny nose. I simply wanted to be tested for flu or strep before I returned to work. They did not take my temperature or anything, but asked me if I had been to China. When I responded that I had recently been to Europe (not China), the doctor came out and said, “I will not see you. You need to leave”.
She made me feel like a freak and she did not treat me like a fellow human being. I asked, “you won’t even test me for flu?”  And she said, “no, you need to go to the ER. This is serious.”
I went to another doctor’s office and it turns out I have a sinus infection. These people should be ashamed of the way they treat patients. I went there for help and I was turned away very rudely.

resp.text:
Morgan,
We apologize for your experience at our center. There is a protocol for international travel and we do not turn away patients that need care. This situation is being addressed and handled by management. If you would like to discuss further, you may contact us at: info@urgentteam.com.

name: Dee Rachela Houston
text: Always wonderful from the moment you walk in until you leave. Truly a wonderful staff! Even my kids love to come because they have a kid friendly table and crayons w printouts. Above and beyond and the medical team here is superb!

name: Captain Krunch
text: Took my insurance card, charged me a 10 dollar co pay. 3 weeks down the road I received a bill for the full amount. I seen a similar review of this here and had I known this was going to happen then i just would have left. Seems pretty shady to me.

resp.text:
Sorry for the delayed response. Our centers offer a safe credit card payment option called Secure Pay. The front desk should have made you aware of this as it provides a convenient and secure method for you to pay your insurance deductible and coinsurance prior to service. Additionally, your credit card will be used to pay any remaining balances your insurance does not cover.

After your visit, we submit your medical claim to your insurance company for the services provided. Once your insurance company pays its contracted portion, you will receive a statement in the mail explaining the portion your insurance paid and what (if any) balance is your responsibility. You will then have 14 days from the statement date to either arrange for another method of payment or request more information regarding the bill. If we have not received payment after 14 days, Secure Pay will charge your credit card for the balance due.

If you would like to discuss further, please email your contact information to: info@urgentteam.com and someone will reach out shortly.

name: Em
text: Wait time was minimal but I was misdiagnosed. I was told sinus infection but I actually have shingles that spread to my eye.  I was very clear with my complaints/symptoms, but was still misdiagnosed. (I didn't know it at the time, but all the symptoms I had basically screamed shingles infection.)  You'd think if I'm capable of googling this, a nurse practitioner would have certainly recognized the symptoms and learned about it in school. 🤷🏻‍♀️  She was actually kind of rude, didn't listen to me (obviously) and seemed more concerned with the little brown flecks I have in my irises. Seriously?! I was given antibiotics but should have gotten an antiviral medicine. Timing is crucial with this, and since I didn’t start the medicine in a timely manner, it’s going to take twice as long to heal, and I could lose vision in my eye. This place is probably okay for kids ear infections, bronchitis, etc., but that’s it. I won’t be going back.

name: Destinee Barnes
text: This facility refused to see a patient that had a fever of 101.3 and is 6 weeks pregnant. Told I would have to come back the next morning at 8am. It was 4:30 and they didn’t close until 5.

resp.text: We are sorry we were unable to help you at our center recently. While we take walk-ins, we also encourage the use of our online scheduling to avoid long waits. Unfortunately, due to unprecedented volumes, some centers may reach maximum capacity before the end of posted hours. When this occurs, it is necessary for the center to stop additional registration/check-ins for the remainder of the day. We are making ongoing refinements to meet the community's need for services during the pandemic and keep everyone safe, and apologize if this happened when you needed to see one of our healthcare providers.

name: Lisa Green
text: Had to carry my son in on friday August 17,2019. He had been stung on his face by an unknown bee/wasp. His face had began to swell as well as his eyes swelling shut. I knew we didn't have much time. He was seen immediately and treated with the best care possible. Everyone there was amazing and very professional. Big shout out to the entire staff and a special thank u for calling to check on Alex today. ❤❤❤

name: Brittney Shupe
text: I have been here several times. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. The wait time has never been very long

resp.text: Thanks Brittney

name: Aaron Page
text: Front Clerk was excellent as well as all other support staff. Quick, Efficient, Friendly!

resp.text: Thanks

name: Mercedes Alexander
text: The CRNP and the black nurse where amazing they both were sweet and understanding . My issue is with the receptionist she has ZERO personality and was kind of rude. I would go back because I received good care but I think they should hire more personable office assistants.

name: Breanna Prestage
text: Super fast visit in and out ! Everyone was super friendly and very caring.  I would highly reccomend urgent team in muscle shoals !

name: Archantia Whiteside
text: The Receptionist Is Rude , Didn’t Smile Not Once At Anyone Who Came In Interrupts You ,  While Thinking She Knows Everything Do Better Please Ma’am But Other Than That Great Place And The Nurse Was Sweet And Caring .

name: jaidah riboldi
text: This place is amazing they are totally kid friendly and they have really nice service and will take care of your every need

resp.text: Thank you! Glad we could help!

name: Hunter Barnett
text: Was in and out in 30 mins. Got me taken care of. Much faster and better than Med Plus.

resp.text: Thank you Hunter

name: Kimberley Powell
text: When your sick, you don’t want to get out in public much less wait anywhere and I was in and out here within 30 minutes. Very friendly staff and super clean place! Highly recommended!

name: Dusty McCain
text: Quick friendly knowledgeable staff! Would definitely recommend going here.

resp.text: Thanks Dusty!

name: Jon Cannon
text: They really care about you and your need. Great Medical Treatment. Thanks!!!

resp.text: Thanks

name: Lee Watkins
text:
Positives - Facility is clean. Very little wait time. Staff is friendly. CRNP Erica is thorough and friendly.

Negatives - CRNP Laura is rude. Interrupts. Doesn’t listen. Also brought teenage child in with flu A and cough. They can’t prescribe anything stronger than over the counter. So don’t waste time or money unless you need them to help you pick out an over the counter med. Go to your medical doctor. So I gave it a 1 star as the visit was unproductive and wish I’d waited 12 hours until our pediatrician opened.

resp.text:
Lee,
We are sorry you had this experience at our center. With the flu, the only prescription given is for anti-virals (Tamiflu, and the brand new Xofluza) IF given within the first 48 hours since symptoms first came on. We are more than happy to discuss your treatment (and your son's) further -- if you'd like to send your contact email/phone number directly to: info@urgentteam.com someone will reach out to you shortly.

name: Maria Strickland
text: Came in 10 mins before closing my husband had poison oak and they took him in with no problem. Very friendly people and was in and out quickly.

resp.text:
Maria,
Thanks for your review, we appreciate your feedback. Glad we were able to help.

name: Patrick Oliver
text: Great staff , fast, super friendly and great care everytime !

resp.text: Happy to oblige!

name: Cody Braly
text: Haley, Sherka, and Nataline provided very great, fast, and professional service.

resp.text: Thanks

name: Reyaires Anderson
text: Very friendly staff, clean facilities, always very helpful. Wait time is little to none and the nurses are always caring to each situation you may have.

resp.text:
Reyaires,
Thanks for the 5-star review. We appreciate it. We are glad you had a good experience and hope you rely on us in the future to help take care of you.

name: Gee Connson
text: I used these people once, your best advice is if you are reading this and your name has not been called yet leave and go to some where down the street.

name: Brandon Staggs
text: They charged my insurance company $409 for a a 5 minute office visit that included no lab work or anything. It’s a scam.

resp.text:
Brandon,
Unfortunately there is an after hours fee that is billed (to some insurances) for hours outside of regular office hours. If you wish to discuss further and see your cost breakdown, please contact us directly at: info@urgentteam.com

name: Charlotte Chamberlain
text: Super nice staff..It didn't take long. Fast diagnosis ..Thanks for helping me today.

name: Rhonda Mannon
text: Super friendly and caring staff. Love them here!

name: Jaz N
text: Usually no long wait. Always friendly and helpful. My kids and I have been here multiple times.

name: Dar Spe
text: Everything was fine as I signed in to see the dr. They took my insurance card and charged my copay but a couple weeks down the road I received a bill for the entire amount. I found out later they dont take my insurance. There was no mention to me of this or I would have left. Now I owe over 120$ because of it. I won't go back that's for sure. I have a very well known insurance ot would have paid but now I'm stuck with a bill.

name: Kimberly Osborne
text: I had to wait 40 minutes to see anybody. There was only 2 people in front of me. The nurse told me i tested positive for the flu but are thought it was alloy gone so she didn't give me a prescription for it. Needless to say I'm worse Rossi than yesterday andI feel I waisted my money going here. The receptionist let me stand there for 10 minutes after I see the nurse waiting for a paper to take to my job.

resp.text: Kimberly, We are sorry you’ve had this experience at our center. And sorry you are not feeling well. We would appreciate the opportunity to follow up directly with you. Please email your name and email address and/or phone number to info@urgentteam.com and a center manager will reach out to you shortly to discuss. Thank you.

name: ANTOINE Robinson
text: Best Urgent Care clinic in the area !!!! Hands down!!

resp.text: Thanks Antoine!

name: Kellie Calderon
text: Great service. Modern

name: Stitchedbyyoshi
text: Great timing and staff was profesional

name: Linda Hudson
text: Friendly, professional staff, very clean facility!

name: Thomas Pitts
text:
I'm switching pharmacies because the new staff are rude and slightly incompetent. I went into publix during this outbreak ONLY to get my medicines which i had filled over the phone. When I got there, one of my prescriptions didn't have any more refills on it and the pharmacist was very unprofessional and raised her voice at me about not having a doctor and 'it's not her fault' that the refills weren't in. They seem to be unstable individuals and I don't have any faith in whatever Publix is calling this pharmacy. Go somewhere else for quality, local service that you deserve. I am.

Only giving 2 stars bc Publix can fill your prescription at other locations in town. That was useful only ONCE and it was during this outbreak.

name: Mary Harvell
text: I absolutely love this store! It's clean and everyone is so helpful and very kind. Keep up the great work!!

name: J B
text:
Will never go to this pharmacy again after the way I was just treated by the pharmacist on duty. Dark haired caucasian women. From the second I stepped to the window with my prescription paper she gave me attitude. First she started with "we close in 20 minutes." Questioned if my scripts came from the hospital or where they came from. I had just been seen at urgent care on hughes road, as it says on my prescription paper, diagnosed with pneumonia. Then asking me if ive had medications filled there before which i have but its been awhile.  she couldnt find me in the system so that was more attitude like its my fault. How about you do your job and enter me in the system then. The last straw was her getting an attitude with me because I dont have insurance and I use the GoodRX app. I grabbed my prescription paper and left.
Total lack of customer service and manners.

name: Diana Holland Faust
text: They seem to be very efficient and professional at this pharmacy.  And it is nice that they know their customers by sight and by name, even new ones -- not something you see very often.

name: Elizabeth Ludwig
text:
I will never use this location again. I have never taken the time to leave a formal complaint before, but I took the time to bring my experience to the manager’s attention. I have to say I have never felt so belittled or offended by someone in a place where patience and a sense of comfort should be paramount.

I called in a refill of my prescription of simple generic birth control around 2:40pm. I was informed it would be at least an hour. So, when I came by to pick it up at 5:15pm I was surprised to find my prescription was somehow at the downtown location. I was informed by the staff that it would be a 30 minute wait. This was in a clipped exchange where there was no apology or assurance. Unfortunately, my husband had to go back to work so, I told them I would pick it up tomorrow.

Unfortunately, that is not the end of this story. I had time later that evening to go try again around 6pm or so. When I walked back in I actually heard them whisper and groan, “It’s her”. One pharmacist, a tall, thin woman with glasses, exasperatedly began to tell me just how many prescriptions they had to fill that night and how when I said tomorrow mine had been pushed back. This was my prepackaged birth control that they had in stock. I could be wrong but I am fairly certain that it only requires a print out to give it, or at least that's all I have ever seen. I was informed that they could manage it in 15 minutes, and so I waited and inquired about how to move my prescriptions.

So, I waited feeling belittled and absolutely uncomfortable. I decided if I had 15 minutes I would make a complaint to customer service. Once that was done I went on my way, but as soon as I got home and spoke to a friend she too had a series of stories about the tall pharmacist with glasses. What's worse are the reviews I have now read about others experiences. Clearly, this is not a good location in customer service or in quality.

name: Jennifer Day
text: I had foot surgery today and it has been one of the most painful experiences of my life. My husband dropped my pain med script by this pharmacy today and my mother went to pick it up a couple hours later. When she got the medicine home I counted them (because I've always heard you should do this with pain meds). There were supposed to 15 in the bottle and, sure enough, there were only 14. Now I'm super frustrated because I know there is nothing I can do about since my mother didn't count them in front of them. The only thing I thought to do was write a review. Hopefully this help someone else in the future. Do not use this pharmacy! Someone there is likely acting unlawfully and I know I don't want to give them the opportunity to possibly do it again.

name: Carolyna Austin
text: Good staff just like Pinnacle of Providence.

name: Mike Rushlow
text: Clean good customer services nice staffed

name: Danielle Burgess
text: Doctor Nazareno is very thorough and personal. It is hard to find a doctor with her kind of work ethic these days. If she says she will do it, she will. The staff is always nice to me too. Very awesome!

name: Georgia Patterson
text: Good place for medical emergency

name: Theron G
text: And she is a Bi---

name: john bass
text: THEY WON'T ANSWER THE PHONE LOL!!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: marian guidry
text: Dr. Matthew Hunt of Valley Surgical Associates has made me one happy, lipoma free lady. After more that ten years of lipoma growth and the last two years looking for someone to remove it,  I was recommended to see Dr. Matthew Hunt. I loved him from the minute he walked through the door and love him even more now that I’m lipoma free. Excellent bedside manners, very calming, fun person and highly recommended. Excellent team of professionals! Thank you Dr. Hunt!!

resp.text: Hello, Marian. We appreciate the kind words and the 5-star review! We're so pleased to hear your impressions of Dr. Hunt and can't wait to share your comments with him. Thank you for trusting Huntsville Hospital Valley Surgical Associates with your surgical care.

name: Kelly J
text:
I had surgery with Dr Marc Zelickson several years ago when he was at a previous practice, and it was a great experience. When I found out on 8/15/2020 that I would need my gallbladder removed, I called his office and scheduled an appointment for 8/20/2020. When I started running a fever and having chills on 8/16/2020 (which is one of the things the hospital ER nurse practitioner warned me to seek care for if it happened) my primary physician started me on antibiotics and recommended that I contact Dr Zelickson’s office and leave a message for his nurse so that they could hopefully see me sooner.

Instead, his nurse asked me “why I thought it was my gallbladder anyway” and (mistakenly) informed me that gallbladder issues don’t cause fevers. She said she would have to ask if they could still see me in the office at all because of this. Never mind that my primary physician’s office understood that there is a possibility of infection, and never mind that the ER physician and nurse practitioner both understood this as well. This nurse didn’t believe it was an issue. She acted like I had no idea what I was talking about and had just decided all on my own that I needed my gallbladder removed.

I immediately contacted another surgeon’s office. Nobody there had a problem understanding what was going on- the nurses didn’t , the surgeon didn’t, and the receptionist didn’t. She had me come in that very same afternoon (yesterday, 8/18/2020) and my wonderful new general surgeon recognized the issue at hand. He removed my gallbladder this morning (8-19-2020) and it was necrotic and covered in pus. THAT is what was causing my fever, and THAT is how a knowledgeable office handles this.

Dr Zelickson and his nurse were flat-out wrong. His nurse called me later yesterday (after I had already called and spoke to receptionist about why I was canceling my appointment) because they needed to reschedule me due to my temperature. Thank goodness I found a surgeon with qualified nurses who actually know how to recognize an infection. I couldn’t eat and could barely drink from 8/15/2020 on. I made Dr Zelickson’s office aware of this also when I made my initial appointment. I really liked Dr Zelickson and his staff when he was at the previous practice but this one is absolutely terrible. They had no problem ignoring my symptoms and apparently believe signs of infection aren’t a thing.

Also, even though I called and canceled my appointment for tomorrow (8/20/2020), and then told the nurse I was canceling my appointment and going elsewhere, I’ve still gotten reminder calls so I have to call yet again I suppose and make sure they know I’m not coming because I wouldn’t put it past them at this point to try and bill me for a missed appointment.

name: Dave Watley
text: Dr Hunt is a very attentive Doctor with an excellent bedside manor. He is very knowledgeable and really gives you peace of mind.

resp.text: Hello, Mr. Watley, and thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We're glad to hear that Dr. Hunt was able to put you at ease, and we'll make sure he sees your nice comments.

text: Dr Shreeder saved my life! I will always be thankful for her and the team at valley!! They are wonderful, always check on you and answer each question.  God blessed me with these Suregeons, Nurses, and front desk!! Thank you from the bottom of my heart!

resp.text: We are happy to hear that you had a wonderful experience with Dr. Schreeder and our team at Valley Surgical Associates. It's our pleasure to care for patients in our community. Your nice comments will be shared with our team.

name: Sheila McCauley
text: I went to Dr. Downey with some apprehension about what to expect in having a tumor removed that had lodged itself inside a muscle. Dr. Downey, his receptionist, his nurse and all of his staff welcomed me with smiles and approachable conversation, they created a calm and healing atmosphere for me. Going into surgery the following day from my office visit I had apprehension regarding the anesthesia and any complication one might get concerned could go wrong. Dr. Downey and the Madison/Huntsville Hospital staff, anesthesiologist and nurses again created a calm and healing atmosphere. I have only had 3 surgeries in my lifetime but my experience with Dr. Downey and all of his nurses, anesthesiologist and staff created an experience that didn’t even seem like a surgery. I have never had such a great experience in a doctors office let alone in a hospital or surgery. Way to go Dr. Downey and Madison/Huntsville Hospital, you have aced bedside manner in the health care industry. I highly recommend and if I could grade I would 500%. Very pleased and impressed by everyone.

resp.text: Hi, Sheila! Thank you so much for the amazing review and for sharing your story. We're so glad that our team put you at ease and made it a better surgical experience than you were expecting. We'll make sure Dr. Downey and the rest of the Valley Surgical Associates team sees your comments.

text: Dr. Zelickson was wonderful. He has a great patient repor. He eased my mind and explained exactly what he was going to do. He was also, kind enough to work me into his busy schedule! Thumbs up for Dr. Zelickson!

text: I have used several different chiropractors over the past 25 years and I will say that hands down Dr. Marino is the best! He actually cares about the well being of his patients and really listens to you when you have a specific problem. He doesn’t just do an adjustment and hope for the best. He actually fixes the problem! I highly recommend him if you are needing to visit a chiropractor!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words. We try daily to achieve the best results in the shortest amount of time! Dr. Marino.

name: Daniel Michael
text: Mike listens. Then he makes an informed decision about your health needs. I can’t give 10 stars because I’m limited to only 5.

name: Ashley Carpenter
text: Hands down the very best Chiropractor in the World!!!No joke! Amazing results after 1 time

name: Lisa Wilder Brown
text:
Dr. Marino is very knowledgeable, great experience, never disappointed.
Over 18 years ago, I suffered from plantar fasciitis. So painful in the mornings it took me a while to get out of bed. He used the Graston technique for 4-5 visits. Never had another episode - EVER! - still to this day!
Highly recommend him for any ailment!

name: Christian Oliveros
text: Definitely a life changer. Didn't know what to do or where to even begin. Between partial paralysis, insomnia, and irregular breathing, many things ailed me. I paid a visit to Dr. Marino and learned a lot about how something so simple could vastly affect the way my body works. A "neural reset" as he describes it. Felt much better after my first visit. Make bi-weekly visits to keep my body in better condition. I really appreciate what he's done for me.

name: Keri S
text: Dr. Marino is the most knowledgeable chiropractor I've ever met! He is caring and informative. He is typically able to diagnose without the use of X-rays or diagnostic imaging and uses a range of diverse techniques to ensure the right kind of adjustment. After the adjustment he even gives advice on stretches and exercises to do to relieve pain when it starts as well as to prevent it in the future if done as recommended. He also suggested supplements to take and specific foods to either avoid or eat more of to achieve a completely healthy and balanced body. It's amazing the things that chiropractic care can help with that don't even appear to be related until you remember that your nerves control everything and all your nerves are connected to the spine. He is also the one that does the acupuncture, which I might just have to try now. I highly recommend this chiropractor no matter what the pain or problem he CAN help either himself or at least point you in the right direction.

text:
My experience the last few visits has been to be generally ignored at the counter for a few minutes before being acknowledged, and then a few more minutes before someone helps.
This last time I went to pick up 2 prescriptions.  I had received a text message about an hour and a half before that a prescription was ready, so I assumed they would both be ready.  After I was finally waited on, she only had 1 prescription so I asked about the other one, to which she replied "It hasn't come through".   I thought that was strange as they should have both been ordered from the Dr's office at the same time, but I said I'd go home and call the doctor.  When I arrived home 15 minutes later I received a text stating that I had another prescription ready at the Publix pharmacy, so the order apparently had come through and she either didn't know how to check or didn't bother.
I'm going to look for a better pharmacy.

text: im not giving this any stars it made me check one to post  the dr called in my meds to publix at cottonwood corners about 2 pm today i got to publix about 2.30 and was told it would be about 40 minutes so i said ill be back in a little while to get it i get back at 5.30 pm 3 hours later wait behind 3 other cars for my turn in the drive thur i  was waited on by  Erin H.who ask for my name then walked away and was gone for quite a few mintues when she returned it was to ask me to drive around the building and get back in line as another car was now behind me and i  ask is my meds not ready she we are finishing yours up now so if you will just drive around and come back so i said i left here 3 hours ago being told my meds would be ready in fourty minutes what happened to that she shugged her shoulders and said we got busy and i said ok so if i was was waiting in the parking lot all this time i would still be waiting she said i dont know and i said well im not moving she said well we are working on yours now i said i have a problem with them not being ready after 3 hours she laughed turned off her speaker and walked away so to publix i know losing my business will not make one difference in your pay check you will make the same without my help but it does make a difference to me that i  have a choice to go else where and i plan on doing so tomorrow morning to the people i made wait behind me im sorry it wasnt my choice i would rather my meds been ready after 3 hours  to the young lady who waited on me  you need to practice ypur customer skills or continue to lose publix one  more customer here and there  till it does make a difference and your jobless you may find then  who pays you is the customers and before you laugh and walk away you remember that so with all that being said  i will not take a spot in your drive thur again and i hope publix begins to act like more than a fast food drive thur for the customers they keep

I am one of those persons that have white coat syndrome and for good reasons, but my visit yesterday served to dispel my trepidation of physicians and staff!

The whole office was practicing safe distancing and wearing masks.

Just a week out of surgery I have been to Physical Therapy and they say I’m doing great! The pain comes a goes depending on the amount used, but after the damage I had, following the surgery I can already tell a huge improvement! I highly recommend Dr.Blum and him staff! They are wonderful and always explain all the details of everything they are doing.

text:
I just left the emergency room and going in I was skeptical, mainly because I had read the other reviews.  I am so glad I didn't feed into the negativity and decided to judge for myself. Dawn was my nurse and so pleasant and patient with me.  I also was seen by Dr Juan? spelling may be incorrect but also very nice. I learned what my mother had already taught me, never assume you know based on the opinions of others, judge for yourself. Great advice momma R.I.P and thank you. I am still listening :)

Also the Dr. can really rock a handlebar mustache!

name: George Guilford
text:
First impressions are everything in repeat business! I am very disappointed in my "very short" visit with Dr. Rosenstiel and staff. (Well I didn't even meet Dr. Rosenstiel???!) Being that I live in Montgomery, I have to request a day off for ALL my eye appointment visits.  I am not new to UAB Callahan Eye Hospital as I've had multiple surgeries within the last three years there. As a matter of fact I just had an appointment there two weeks ago with the incredible Dr. Priscilla Fowler and staff.   I've been diagnosed with Kerataconus and Dr. Priscilla Fowler is my primary eye doctor.  Dr. Fowler and staff are some of the nicest people I've met in the eye care industry. Earlier this year and this past month I received the Cross-Linking  procedure.  I spent over $6000 within the last three years at Callahan eye.  Dr. Fowler and staff treat me with respect on EVERY visit,  yet on December 10 with Dr. Rosenstiel and staff I felt the lesser of.  This visit was scheduled to replace my old sclera lenses with new.  You would think before my arrival they would've did their research on my condition.  Upon my arrival in the room, Dr. Rosenstiel's nurse asked if I ever had sclera lenses?? (I'VE HAD SCLERA CONTACTS FOR THE LAST 6 YEARS??) From there, he goes straight into and I quote, "before we even see you, you have to pay X amount of dollars!?. Furthermore, he adds, "The Lenses will be an additional $XXXX.XX amount of dollars to get them?   Now at this point I was feeling as though they did not want to help me as Dr. Fowler and staff did you for the last couple of years.?  Now do mind you I've already spent thousands of dollars to get my eyes corrected.  The money is not an option, but I felt inferior to his demands.  I also wondered have they even looked in my charts from previous visits.? "Have they even checked my insurance" I thought to myself?  At that point I asked him a series of questions in terms of verifying my insurances and deductibles. To no avail he says nothing will be covered. Now as I mentioned money would not be a concern as I've spent a lot of money to fix my Eye disease. ( As well as the removal of an tumor in my eyelid two years prior ).  More questions came to mind in this parlay with Dr. Rosenstiel's nurse.  At this point I felt that the nurse is trying to rush me so he leaves then comes back with a business card and prices on it. He then states, " if you have any questions please call Melissa" on the business card. I agreed and proceeded to leave. Upon leaving, I felt very embarrassed to even be there. I rushed out and got in my car. I kept thinking to myself "have they even check my insurance". So I called my wife, and she confirmed we do have Eye insurance.  I decided I needed to call them back to confirm and verify with them that I have insurance, the same insurance I've used last three years. Two calls later and one left message, I still have not heard from Melissa, Dr. Rosenstiel , or the male nurse that was talking to me. I never even got to meet Dr. Rosenstiel??? I will still come up to visit Dr. Fowler but I will do my business elsewhere in finding new Sclera lenses!
Very disappointing!!

name: John McDole
text: Whether visiting the Emergency Room or scheduled surgery this is the place to be for anything eye related. Over the years we have never had a problem or bad experience or even an unpleasant encounter. Everyone is very professional. The doctors offices being within the complex make it convenient and the parking deck connects to the complex.

name: April Mejia
text: Staff was extremely nice and professional. Amazing doctors and nurses.

name: Christy Pierce
text: Awesome atmosphere. Friendly and professional staff. Highly recommend.

name: Ethan Vaughn
text:
I took the day off from work to drive 2.5 hours to take my son here. Apparently the optometrist had to take the day off the day before so she was seeing yesterday's patients as well as todays. Which is fine.
What is not fine is the complete lack of foresight or common courtesy to call today's patients to inform them they may have to wait longer we have been waiting for 2 hours and are looking at atleast another hour wait before our son is seen. This office is a perfect storm of incompetence and disregard for their patients.

name: Kevin G
text: Had a major eye injury last week. The nurses and dr quickly relieved my pain and identified the problem quickly. Today I have most of my vision back due to them.

name: Glenda Cook
text: Spent time and alot of money on the doctors and prescriptions and with no answer about my eye pain.The doctors and staff were kind but it still didn't help in the end.

name: Regina Lavender
text: Best Doctors! Waiting time is cut in half! Diagnosis and exams are private issues. Insurance coverage is acceptable. Lots of parking space. Friendly employees and emergency care is available.

name: Dawn Teeters
text: The waiting room here is really nice. Phone charging stations, comfortable seating, large TV's, and a Starbucks coffee machine that unfortunately is not free. $2 for a small coffee

name: Teresa Hill Berry
text: I hope you have better luck than I did. I prefer the clinic on the first floor the Lyons Clinic with Doctor Reid.

name: Shawna Gomez
text:
Only because I can not put zero as an option! I spoke with a man ,who barely allowed me to even talk, and he kept telling me there's no way my daughter's appointment is there, I still have the letter as proof. My daughter is not even 2 and needs eye surgery badly. Her appointment is scheduled for 4/2/18 but as I said he told me there is no way she has one there.

I have 2 kids they are my world. This issue needs to be resolved. If my daughter doesn't get her surgery because the man I spoke to is incompetent, I'm not going to be a very happy mom and if any of you are parents you'd understand.

name: Chris Mahan
text: It is very concentrated on helping people live better, and the medical staff is excellent.

name: Miss Un-PC
text:
My mom and I were rear ended severely a while back by a young boy more interested in his cell phone than his driving.
At first, I didn't notice anything wrong. Later that night, my right eye had a shadow-like film over it. I didn't think anything about it at first. Later that week, I notice my vision was decreasing. I was half blind in my right eye. I went to my eye doctor. After a check-up, he said my retina was partially detached. And, had I waited a week or so longer, I would've have gone permanently blind in that eye. I got an appointment at the Callahan Eye Foundation.
The doctors, nurses and receptionist were very nice. The surgeon did a fantastic job reattaching my retina. The only thing that was a bit frustrating was that gas bubble. But, it kept pressure on my retina. Now, my vision in the right eye was like it was before the accident.
If you have a problem with your eyes that a regular eye doctor can't treat, then I highly recommend the Callahan Eye Foundation.

name: Jay J
text: I wish I could give a minus star. I stopped by here with a rash on my skin near my eye after hours. I was afraid that it might swell up and cause me further issue. They sent me to the ER. I asked could I see someone not in the ER so I would not have to pay so much, but they said no. So I saw a doc in the ER. He looked at my eye and said it was a common rash and said he would give me some antibiotics. He stepped out with the door open and talked to the nurse. I caught them laughing and looking back at me because I came in for a skin rash near my eye.  I believe I was in there for almost 2 hours and I did not see another patient. The lady at the front desk was rude, the staff was rude and even with insurance I still had to pay over $300 .

name: Josie Williams
text: Very knowledgeable about everything i ask never left me wondering i never had any doubt about what was going to happen. Very professional teams

name: M Kennedy
text: They were very nice and took the time to make sure my family got my phone and valuables before surgery. Very caring people.

name: Andy Pesterfield
text:
Do not take your child here.  You can get the exact same care at children's hospital.  1)they use the same doctors 2) children's hospital has a lot more respect your time.  I've been to both....The eye clinic time was RIDICULOUS,  2) children's accepts more insurance providers like medishare.

I spent a lot more money a LOT more time, and less customer service.

They couldn't even call in our prescription after being there for 5 hours!!!!!!

Waited one hour for the nurse to come back with our prescription.  No call for that.

Very disappointed.

name: Sherry Ellis
text: My daughter went to the ER there. He eye was red and she couldn't see threw it. The docs there said there was a white spot on her cornea but they didn't know what it was. Instead off calling in an attending doctor they sent her home work gel drops and told her to make appt with cornea doc the next week. She went in on weekend. Turns out she had a bad corneal infection.  For this I have to pay $100 copay didn't even treat her at all

name: Yolanda Scott
text: My son had to have emergency eye surgery. Everyone was patience. By he grace of GOD, they decided to do a catscan and found tumors Iwould not have known about. Caring staff! My son has another surgery in the morning. I know he is in good hands.

name: B Flows
text: Everything was done as soon as possible when problems arose. Tried new dry eye alternative to help with eye drops and night lube. Thanking​ the community eye professional and staff. State of the art.

name: Dani Perry
text: Very rude and uninformed staff!!! When I made a appointment, the rep said my insurance was accepted. However, when I got there they said they only accepted VSP. I have the Federal Employees Program Vision insurance. When I showed them the Federal Vision Website listed them as providers, they told me it was wrong and the only insurance they took was VSP. So I went all the way down there and took off work for nothing! How does the biggest eye hospital in Birmingham, not accept federal insurance? Sounds fishy to me! Then they wanted me to pay $15 to park! Absolutely not!

name: Myah Phillips
text: Horrible experience. Unfriendly staff. Extremely long wait and when you finally see someone they rush you and don’t take the time to really talk to you and explain anything.

name: Tamara Hicks
text: Extremely long wait for an "ER". staff is incredibly RUDE.  ZERO sense of urgency to treat patients!

name: Marcia Larson
text: doctors were thorough, kind and personable while female members of staff at desk were very rude, condescending, overbearing - can't find enough adjectives to fully describe how they made me feel and also my family when they got there.  Not nice people in fact creepy

name: Queen railyn
text: When you have eye trouble best place too go

name: Dusty Whitt
text: I have keratocotus in my left eye for a couple years it's a condition we're the cornea has changed shape or has wore down the staff which cause your vision to only be corrected with a special made lense to fit your eye ,eye glasses nore regular contacts can fix this condition the  Dr and staff we're very polite and we're able to determine my condition and fit for one of these lense so after 2 yes of being blind in my left eye I can finally see again with the lense although I have learned of a proceedure called cornea cross link that can permanently fix my condition I am hoping to talk too the Dr about and have it done thank you UAB Callahan Hospital

name: Jeannie wright
text: A wonderful place to work. One of very few Eye only hospitals in the US. One of two Eye only ERs in the US. Gold standard for Eye care.

text: Everyone was so nice and kind to my sister. She was the one that had surgery. They kept me updated on her progress.

name: Nancy Hughes
text: This facility was upscaled&Hi_tech professional from word GO.from Kay,calling to set-up surgery.To:Marge in recovery,Cynthia&Elizabeth,Pre-op with R.O..Brittney frontline receptionist Terry,Ashley upon arriving&departing.Dr.Bains extra extrodinary you all excelled&succeed the extra mile in care top quality May you all be richly blessed always.Thank You for the care you gave&showed to me&my Mother with forever grateful heart love you all!!!🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

name: Amy Millette
text: 1 doctor and 1 nurse in emergency department, trauma emergency came in right before we were to be discharged, we could not be discharged until they were done with the trauma. Completely ridiculous.

name: Alex Farris
text: Great place to see the best eye doctors in the region

name: Bert Bloomston
text:
I was extremely pleased with the  personal care and attention provided me when I arrived at CEH. I arrived a few minutes prior to the appointed time and waited just a short time prior to be taken to a bed where I was prepped for my cataract surgery. I honestly did not have the feeling that I was in a medical facility, but a facility designed  for the extreme care and concern for a person. All of us, I believe, have anxiety prior to a surgical procedure, however the staff made me feel comfortable and relaxed. I took special note that Mr. Sprayberry was on the floor chatting with the patients and the staff. That is certainly a rarity in today's world of medicine and certainly could not be found in many or any facility today. Also, I learned that there was patient advocate on the floor.
Congratulations to all and to Dr. Sara Mullins for the outstanding treatment and personal attention. Your hospital is way above just first class.
Thank you again and I told many of my friends about your outstanding service and personal care.

name: jesse anderson
text: Didn't  have  today wait  long  for  appointment   and  was very  impressed  by the way I was treated  and care for  while I was there. Staff  was very  helpful and knowledgeable.

text: Very nice nurses and doctors, however the hospital board and administrator Brian Sprayberry(sp) are very irresponsible and inconsiderate just to save money. Closed down 7 out of 9 operating rooms. Arrived 15mins early for my appointment. Ended up leaving after 6 hours of waiting with other patients still ahead of me waiting for surgery!

text: This is for the parking at the hospital. Don't bother bringing a stroller for your children. Not every floor has a ramp to get in the building. It was very difficult lifting our double stroller up four stairs on Friday.

text: We are Montanans, visiting our daughter at U of AL in Tuscaloosa, when my husband had a partially detached, torn retina, that required a 1 hour drive and emergency surgery at Callahan. From the staff at the front desk, to the surgery nurses, and the entire surgery staff, I couldn't be more thankful! we received top notch care and customer service! Thank you! We are so fortunate for the outstanding care we received there! Thanks to Dr's. Sapp, Tabakoli,  NRSA McMullen,  Nurse Alice, Terry ( family aid) and anyone else I may have missed or whose name is misspelled!

name: RMK III
text:
had a toe amputated in July (and another one last year). I saw a Dr. Prince Uzoije on Sept 26, a doctor chosen by Alabama Medicaid Agency to be my primary care provider. I told him that I needed to get something for the pain in my foot and he said he doesn't write prescriptions for pain. when I explained how severe it was he still refused so I asked "what am I supposed to do be a criminal and get homemade drugs like meth-amphetamines, crack cocaine or heroin or something" he then said, "If that's what you have to do."
I have never known of a doctor who condones a patient self medicating particularly with illegal street drugs.
so I'm going to get a new doctor.
but it's OK he'll still get his paycheck and continue to MIStreat people.
I don't know, maybe that's how they do things in the country he's from.

name: loren smith
text: Good medical services

name: Ken Howe
text: Dr. Smith has performed four surgeries on my hands over the past two years. Two carpal tunnel surgeries, one to remove gout related deposits and one To repair a finger which I seriously injured in a saw mishap. Thanks to his skills and a very capable staff I have had fantastic results. I would highly recommend him to anyone in need of hand surgery. Thank you Dr Smith and your great staff!

name: Milton Smith
text: Dr. Smith and his staff are precise and meticulous with their diagnoses. He and the staff were courteous, and  kind in their attitudes toward me. His work has allowed me to be pain free with a very troubling problem.

name: K Brown
text:
I highly recommend Dr. Smith.  He took excellent care of my mother after she fell and required surgery.  He was very patient and kind and thorough with us and answered all our questions.
I went back to him for 2 elective hand surgeries and was very pleased with his care.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the review! Dr. Smith is definitely the best, and we'll pass along your feedback so he knows how great of a job he did. We'll always be ready to provide you with the highest level of service whenever you or your family require orthopaedic expertise.

name: Cindy Thompson
text: Dr. Smith was a wonderful doctor. He did surgery on my thumb and did a great job. I would recommend him if you need a good surgeon. He was very nice and sweet and he set down and talked to me and let me ask questions if I needed to. Just a great doctor. I would definitely go back to him.

resp.text: We appreciate the review, Cindy! We're always happy to hear when we've accomplished our mission of providing 5-star care & service in our clinic.

name: Peggy Morris
text: Dr. Smith is a wonderful, caring doctor.  He diagnosed the issue with my hand, on first visit, and performed surgery. I’m pain-free and able to use it for the first time in months. The staff at Southlake Orthopedics has always been first rate and our family would go no where else for Ortho issues.

resp.text: So thrilled to hear about your experience, Peggy! And we're sure Dr. Smith and the rest of his staff will be excited to hear as well. We're lucky to have such a skilled and experienced surgeon as Dr. Smith as a part of the team.

text: I have the upmost confidence in Dr. Smith.  His background consists of prestigious schools and medical centers and he is very knowledgeable in this field. A great man....a great doctor!!!!!!!  Thank you and God bless each one of you, Keith Tolbert

text: Dr. Smith performed surgery on my hand/wrist to relieve pain.  He tried other options first, which I appreciated. I would highly recommend him for your Orthopaedic needs.

text: Dr. Smith is a great doctor. He explains everything to you in a way that you understand what is going on. Him and his staff take every precaution to keep you safe as well. My mom can use her wrist/hand again now. He told her it would take 3 months after surgery and it took her 3 months just like he said. You could not ask for a better doctor and we highly recommend  him to anyone that needs an orthopedic  for their hand /wrist.  Also want to brag on their physical therapy department ladies Cathy and  Rebekah both are awesome and know their stuff.

Dr Smith ,PA and staff took great care of me and went beyond my expectations.I've been going to Southlake since 1987 and have always been well taken care of.
A+ Thanks

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Mick! Love to hear about a job well-done, but it's even better when we hear we have consistently done a great job!

name: Vicki Smith
text: There is no better surgeon than Dr. Smith.  As painful as the injury was, and the recovery physical therapy, the care was the best ever.  I've had other orthopedic surgeries in several different cities, but the professionalism of the staff is balanced with the genuine concern and care of the entire staff.  Love Dr. Smith, he's the best!

name: Otis Smith
text:
Dr. Smith reconstructed my finger after a table saw accident.  Would have never believed that the finger would have ever looked normal again, little lone functional.
His talent as a surgeon is far and above anything I have ever seen in my 60 years.
An honest, direct, extremely dedicated professional that I have highly recommend to everyone I meet in need of hand surgery.

name: Susan Hulsey
text: I stabbed my hand with a knife cutting an avocado.  Dr. Smith repaired the artery and the nerve in the palm of my hand.  I have regained strength in my hand and sensation in my fingers! I would recommend him to anyone for his knowledge, skill and expertise.  By the way, he is also nice!

name: DAVID V
text: This is the second time I used Dr. Smith for surgery - once on my wrist and once on my hand. He is an outstanding doctor from all aspects and expectations. Of all the 11 doctors that I currently using, he has the best technical skills and follow up after the surgery. Just as important, he has great people skills. He honestly cares about his patients and assures that the patient understands all options, all plans for treatment, and a clear path for recovery.  He is a very nice, caring and down to earth gentleman. I STRONGLY recommend Dr. Smith and the staff at Southlake Orthopaedics.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the feedback!

name: Sheila Marcus
text: Best hand doctor I know

resp.text: Thanks for the high praise, Sheila! We appreciate you choosing our clinic, and we'll be ready to serve again should you or your family ever require orthopaedic services in the future.

name: Dianne Snow
text: Dr. Smith and his staff are absolutely fantastic in every aspect. They meet with you on a personal level making you feel comfortable and at ease. The day of my surgery was a never before experienced event; no sitting and waiting forever - I was taken back almost immediately after arriving, prepared for surgery, saw my husband, taken back and the next thing I knew I was waking up. If surgery could be an enjoyable experience, this one was. Follow up visits have been equally impressive. It’s a joy to deal with professionals of this caliber.

name: Margaret Harrill
text: I fell & broke my wrist at the beginning of the Covid-19 pandemic. Dr. Smith "screwed" me back together with complete success! I was very impressed with the safety precautions practiced at both the outpatient surgery center & the Grandview office. My compliments not only to Dr. Smith for his care but for his team as well, Caroline his PA & Leslie PT. All couldn't have been kinder or more encouraging. In an emergency like mine you just take your chances with the surgeon available & willing to take you on.  With Dr. Smith I won the lottery!

name: Mary Belle Van Der Noord
text: Wonderful experience from beginning to end; I had been suffering from sharp joint pain in my left wrist and thumb that interfered with daily activities as well as my sleep. I am so grateful to Dr. Smith and his team of medical professionals for giving me my hand back!!

I haven’t had the best experiences with doctors in the past so it gave me a refreshed and positive perspective on the medical field. Dr. Smith even calls his patients the night of the surgery to check on you and make sure everything is going ok. He’s been a blessing!

text: Dr Smith really cares and listens to his patients and I feel his quality of services provided are excellent.

text: Dr. Smith is great. His surgical skills are outstanding and he always has time to answer questions. I highly recommend him as an Orthopedic doctor and surgeon.

name: Tommy Dew
text: Very pleased with Dr Smith and the staff. My surgery went well and I will use their services again if needed.

He talked my Dad through the lengthy process, explaining in detail and answering questions in a manner he understood. My Dad’s elbow is doing good, Dr. Smith continues to stay in check. My family is very grateful to Dr. Smith!

The wait time wasn't long at all.  I'm so glad they send home with you, a what to do sheet, because you (I) can't remember whatever after my surgery.

text:

and the Southgate staff. Dr. Smith was good at explaining my treatment and asked me if I had any questions. I would definitely go back to Dr. Smith if further treatment was needed.

text:
The experience we encounter at Dale Medical was poor & extremely unpleasant. Dr Constantine was extremely unprofessional and displayed inappropriate behavior for a physician & surgeon. My father was taking to the emergency rm and needed to have gall bladder surgery. My father has many health issues including dementia. Since my mother & I was out of town she had to be called & informed on what was going on with my father. The R rated tone & words spoken to my mother by this Dr. was extremely disgusting behavior. This Dr. refused to transfer my father at my mother's first request but after Dale Medical realized they were not equipped to handle his major healthcare needs then (3 days later) he was transferred to his physician to complete medical treatment. Today my fathers' mental health condition is worse due to the medication, care received at Dale medical + the reaction he had to the medication. To others BEWARE of the low quality services you will receive! if you have insurance the only goal is to make money off you & not provide you with top quality care needed! Dr. Constantine owes my family especially my mother an apology!
-Liptrot Family

Anyways, look for this hospital to change names to Canada Medical if anything is medically wrong with my heart bc I will sue them for every penny they're worth, which isnt much. The care was pitiful. Took my daughter with severe pelvic pain, finally after hours and hours Dr. came in stating she had several cyst on her ovary and with that being said he told us they couldntc do an ultra sound as there tech was on vacation, that they had no OBGYN on staff. Told us to see one the next day. Duh tomorrow was Saturday. Sad that I thought it would have been better after it became Floyd but that didn't happen either..

text: A nice environment  and caring staff but lack the Specialist sometimes needed. But they will transfer you to a facility that does have one.

name: Linda Mitchell
text: A moderately small cut on my 8-year-olds chin required us to end up at the CMC Emergency Room around 5 in the evening on a Wed. (We tried both Urgent Care Centers but they said we should go to the ER.)  The emergency room wasn't busy at all - maybe 4 patients.   Three hours later a doctor and nurse finally came in to apply skin glue to the cut.  They didn't really seem to know what they were doing and just plastered the glue all over the wound like a 3-year-old with a glue stick and then sent us home.  Having had skin glue used before, I knew this did not look right and you could immediately tell the glue had not sealed the wound because you see fluids building up under it.  Sure enough, by the middle of the next morning the glue had fallen off and the wound was open again.  I decided to just deal with it at home.  I can't believe that I wasted 3 hours and a huge co-pay for this level of incompetence and lack of effective treatment.  I highly recommend driving to anywhere to avoid going here and keep skin glue in your home kit. You can't do any worse.

resp.text:
We're sorry to hear that your experience was not what you had hoped for. We always welcome the opportunity to hear from our patients about how we can continue to improve our service.

Our Service Excellence team is available to speak with you and listen to your concerns. They can be reached by calling 706-509-5195.

name: Josh McClellan
text: Very professional. I suspect most of the negative reviews are from people that unsuccessfully tried to score pills. My copays without insurance are less than my copay at other clinics WITH insurance. If you are on a controlled substance med, expect to be drug tested at every visit, though they're polite about it.

name: Paula Finley
text: This is a family oriented clinic with an excellent staff from reception to triage to examination through follow up.  I get a call within 24 hours of leaving with lab results and referral appointments if necessary.   I am treated like a human being with kindness and genuine concern. I’m not rushed through the stages. I don’t feel like I’m dictating to a data entry clerk typing on an iPad that never even looks me in the eye.  The examination itself with Nell Hannon is the most comforting of all. I go in scared, or sick, or with questions, or all three and she talks to me. She listens intently to what my concerns are and then addresses each one. If I am prescribed medication, she tells me exactly what it is, how and when to take it, and what to expect.   I leave there feeling better, hopeful, and even loved.

name: Vickie Thompson
text: Good environment for family. Over weight people who are sensitive to being told they aren't active enough. You have bad eating habits etc. Wouldn't enjoy the office visit. My family didn't. I am still waiting after a year now with severe pain needing a diagnosis. Otherwise a nice office to visit for day to day over all health needs. I do recomend "Its not their fault they are restricted limitations to the point they can't do more due to so many insurance restrictions. They do the best they can to get text etc. For your overall health needs. They have a nice and friendly staff overall. Go and give them a chance. You will have a over all nice experience.

I have never problems an she slowly gave me a shot an in the wrong place! I was in pain for 15min before it finally calmed down. So upt the door with nothing more than what I brought. Still sick an still off my med! Well never return!

name: Missi Moore
text: Had a wonderful first visit and experience. I had multiple questions. Ms. Amelia answered them all honestly as within the scope of her profession. The front desk, medical assistant, Ms. Amelia, and the check-out personnel were very polite and helpful. I was, however, present when some irritated calls and patients graced their presence. The problems they were agitated about were something that the doctor office simply could only refer them to contact their medicare or insurance about. They simply wouldn’t accept that as so and therefore argued and became very ugly with the staff. The staff was patient and kept their same tone while dealing with the irritated individuals. God bless public service individuals in all fields. I appreciate those that keep a professional attitude and go on with things after such an episode. It’s part of public relations unfortunately and is what makes a good office personnel, great!

I expected to be examined from head to toe as I was with previous dermatologists; however that didn’t happen.  I was asked if I had any concerns and one was frozen but that about summed it up.  What a waste of time and money.  Needless to say I won’t be going back.

The staff

No crutches no nothing and didn't even help to my truck. Don't take your dog or cat here.

text: I had a horrible experience here yesterday. I went in for a black widow bite with pains and difficulty breathing. They ran tests for almost 4 hours and would not give me any medicine. I was discharged with no treatment whatsoever. I will never go back to this hospital.

resp.text: Hi mitchellavice, we'd love to learn more about your experience so we can identify any concerns you may have. Would you Please reach out to our Regional Manager of Patient Experience, Avanti Ammons at AAmmons@primehealthcare.com, or by phone at 256-543-5281. We hope that we will have the opportunity to connect with you soon.

name: Mary Ragsdale
text: They are alot better hospital than alot of people give them credit for. They emergency waiting time is generally pretty fast. They work hard and do their job. Just because they don't hand you a prescription for a pain pill doesn't mean they aren't doing they're job. They are aware of Alabama's drug and pain pill abuse. Get high on life not drugs or pills.

name: Nancy Haverly
text:
A friend of mine went to the emergency room with a severely swollen knee and a very noticeable abscess.  He was in severe pain. The doctor came in pushed and prodded the area. He was given a shot of antibiotics and 2 ibuprofen. He was told to follow up with an Orthopedic Doctor that he informed them he couldn't afford.  He was given NO CARE OR RELIEF OF PAIN NOR TREATED other than the above.
Previously my fiancee spent 4 days in there for pancreatitis eating ice chips because the charge nurse forgot to call the specialist who should have seen him the next day upon admission
.My animals receive better care from their veterinarian.

name: MATT ELLIS
text: Never had a friend or family member make it out alive. Well cept one, he was bit by a black widow and they left him alone for 2 hours till he got up and went to a hospital that cared.

resp.text: Hi MATT ELLIS, We value all feedback and appreciate you taking the time to share. Your feedback is very important to us in our ongoing efforts to provide service of the highest quality to our patients and their family members. Please reach out to our Regional Manager of Patient Experience, Avanti Ammons at AAmmons@primehealthcare.com, or by phone at 256-543-5281.

name: Lindzy Wilson
text: Got back to a room very fast. Great service from employees. The male doctor in the ER was VERY nice!! The staff have great patience! They continued to be very helpful to me as the patient next to me begged and cussed loudly for pain meds. Great service!

name: Dannielle Sudeña
text:
DO NOT TAKE YOUR LOVED ONE HERE!
My grandmother went in with stomach pain and was on life support for months. Once I figured out that her condition was bad due to subpar care, The family immediately asked for her nurses to be switched and only certain nurses to care for her. Her condition has improved ever since and now she is healthy and at home.
The CCU and ICU unit are horrible!!!!!! My grandmother had multiple bedsores that we did not know about until she was moved to a different floor.
There are a handful of great nurses in those units, but certain nurses are horrible. NEVER BE AFRAID TO ASK FOR A DIFFERENT NURSE. IT WILL SAVE YOUR LOVED ONE'S LIFE.

The manager tried to defend the nurse I complained about. Stand your ground. You have a right to quality care!

name: Devin Fulton
text: Worst hospital I've ever step foot in. They don't listen to their patients. They didnt listen to me. So i'm currently at a different hospital about to have surgery to remove my gallbladder, Which is extremely infected.

name: Jennifer Craig
text:
Absolutely horrible experience there on 12/3/18. Staff sat around joking having a good time while my fiance sat bleeding for hours waiting to get stitches in his hand. The nurse practitioner showed absolutely no care to him and seemed like he didn't want to be bothered. Emergency room had been cleared out for hours and no one came. Even after asking if he was forgotten nothing was done. Walked out of ER still with no stitches after 3.5 hrs and still actively bleeding
There was a dirty used needle laying in the room floor as well and it was brushed off like it happened all the time

name: Don Walters
text: They didn't  give my wife her Parkinson meds according to her daily schedule and she is still hallucinating weeks after leaving the hospital.

We hope that we will have the opportunity to connect with you soon.

text: No Stars. Majority of the "nurses" are a joke, especially in surgery. Never seen more filth under one roof. Everybody is screwing everybody, literally at work in the empty hospital rooms! Satan's playground for employees. Seriously, get a penicillin shot before you enter the place. DO NOT have surgery here.

text: I want to thank the nurses and staff on the 7th floor tower for taking great care of me and seeing all needs were met. Everyone that came into my room was gracious and attentive.

text: Doctors and nurses services was great! Friendly, caring staff oveeall. The food and the food service was terrible. Orders were never right or fresh.
