text: Tabitha Brown on 7th was one of the CNA's that took care of a family member and she was simply AMAZING!! There definitely need more CNA's like her there.

text: They made a lot of changes don't listen to theses reviews. My mom had a cardiac arrest and they had it done in a week great service. She is fine now.

text: So very nice always asking if i needed something and it was my husband that was in hospital and they took such great care of him I want to Thank everyone there

name: Kelley Ireland
text:
I went to er for infected cat bite, cleaned, xrays, antibiotic, shots.... sent home BUT was told if worse came back. 4 hrs later I was back... signed in at er... before I could take a seat... Dr came out ( same dr) looked at arm and said come with me.... admitted on 4th floor the spot! Care was wonderful... admitted, iv started, wound cleaned, internal infection Dr called in, procedure in place within 1 hr!!!
Nurses were FANTASTIC...  if I had questions... they were answered.... no stone was left unturned! Highest praise...

name: Lynn Dobbins
text: This place is garbage! They do not care about the patient or family members. No one can ever be on the same accord. Nurses, tell you something totally different than doctors & when you get to the bottom of things, they all are lying. This is one facility that I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND!!! They are a DISGRACE to the medical community. If care anything about your love ones please take them elsewhere.

name: Nevergivenup 123
text: Feb 23, 2016 I was in the ER about 5 hrs. I was told after 2 hrs I was being admitted. They had a room that had to be cleaned. Then I was move after a total of 5 hrs. Anyways the ER doctor was terrible   no beside manner and didn't really even examine me. I went to the ER for shortness of breath. X-rays and blood work was ok. After I was moved to my room the 3rd floor nurses were not even concerned about my well being. I didn't use the call button all night. Then I did that morning and it took 45 min for the nurse to get to my room. And the doctor on my floor has done nothing. No test have been ordered or anything. I was in this hospital twice last year and I couldn't have ask for better top notch care. I don't know what has happened this go around. I'm writing this review as I'm laying here for nothing and me and my insurance is getting this outrageous  bill. I'm about to sign and leave on my free will. Very disappointed. My doctor this time here isn't Dr Jazwal. If it was he would not allow this kind of care..

name: joevgirl 4_ever
text:
Excellent hospital, doctors, nurses and staff. I was treated with renal failure on thanksgiving day.  They were very nice and I plan the go back and thank the staff that treated me and helped me. I am still in bad shape but trying to heal slowly. I was a GFR of 28 and now been stable at 47. This wasn't anything I done wrong but I had to take a medication that causes renal failure but usually is reversed. Can't thank all the doctors staff and nurses, even techs and imaging for all their help. Very professional and curtious. I did ask why they were so nice because I had been treated hostile at another facility and by a few specialist and their response was " it could be one of us in your position". They kept me calm, wasn't hateful not neglectful. When I went back on new years Eve in pain they understood, helped me and sent me home after finding out my gfr was a little better.

I could go on forever and wish I had the names of ppl who treated me. All I know is it was the best treatment and hospitality I've had this past year. I guess I had been going to wrong hospital before this one.

name: Gary Taylor
text: I absolutely love the hospital, and the nurses are the very best! I have been admitted 5 times in the past 2 months. They have taken such wonderful care of me. I wouldn't use any other hospital besides Riverview hospital, except UAB. I have a specialist in Gadsden and kirklin clinic, UAB that take good care of me.

name: Angela Mekertichian
text: Avoid this hospital at all cost. There is no care. Doctors are hard to come by and they do not care. My best friend was there for 4 days and past away. They could not even find what was wrong and he got so I'll that I could not move him. Terrible place. And 2 weeks later the doctor still can't be bothered to sign the death certificate.

name: S Owens
text: MARK your parking spaces CLEARLY if you don't want anything but Emergency vehicles to park in the two spaces just outside the ER.  Neither are marked and I was told by an ambulance driver I would be towed.   That would have cost you my attorney fees and the cost of them towing my car.  By first appearance, those are legal parking places for everyone.

name: Super Straight
text:
Went to this hospital last night at midnight with a family member who had an extremely high heart rate and was in a lot of pain. We were both terrified, thought this person might be having a small heart attack and could ultimately die. We get to the front desk of the ER and a young, skinny black woman was working it. Nobody was in the waiting room, keep in mind. We tried to check in, give her the insurance cards, tell her it’s very urgent.... and she’s got her head propped up on her left hand, slowly clicking things on her computer. She gives us the WAIT finger. Doesn’t say a single word. Just 👆🏻 the YOU CAN JUST WAIT A MINUTE finger. We sit down for 20 mins. She’s still clicking away. Looking disgruntled as ever. We go back up to the desk to try to reiterate how urgent this is ansnto basically beg her to take our insurance or whatever it is she needs to get us seen ASAP. We get the finger again. We then called Gadsden regional hospital and they said “Yes we will get you in immediately! Come now!!!”  They took care of my family member at Gadsden Regional and they feel better than they have in a year!!!

But I can’t figure out why these people act like that. Did we interrupt her Facebook scrolling? What did we do wrong but want to check in and get seen ASAP. We were (and always are) VERY nice and understanding. We know nobody is a miracle worker. But this is on another level of disgusting and piggish. What if my family member died while she played on the computer for almost half an hour and never ever got us checked into the system?! The place was empty. I guess she thought she could be lazy that night and was upset by us coming in and having an emergency, in turn making her have to do a little work. This was on 1/19/18 at MIDNIGHT in the ER.  Couldn’t get her name because I kept getting shoes off. She never spoke to us ONCE. I know Riverview will do nothing about this though and keep this heartless woman on as an employee. They could care less. GO TO GADSDEN REGIONAL IF AT ALL POSSIBLE!!!!!!

name: eric williams
text: While mother was in E.R. Male nurse was very rude to the point of being mean to her. We got the er supervisor involved and problem fixed with that incident. Then afterwards they admitted her we come into her room to check on her and she tells me a male nurse was trying to bathe her which was unnecessary to say the least. The night before that garbage was overflowing and all over the room and let’s keep in mind that this is a hospital. No hand sanitizer in room after asking for days. Bed sheets had not been changed in days also. Got another supervisor involved, and this man had the nerve to not only have a security escort but accused me of being rude to his staff. I grew up in a military family and say yes sir and yes ma’am to everyone I come across. Needless to say I will be contacting the board of directors for this mans total incompetence. But the best thing I can say about this hospital is the nurses on cardiac step down are some of the best I’ve seen in any hospital, very responsive and respectful. Also, Jane Yates was great and needs to be supervisor of not just the E.R. But I would say the whole hospital.

name: michael moeller
text: No zero option. The ER  is beyond inept. The entire area around room 12 in the ER is very dirty and smells.

name: Carlene Valentine
text: I am scheduled to do the pre-op testing today for foot surgery on Friday. NO ONE CALLED ME TO LET ME KNOW WHEN TO SHOW UP FOR this. I called them even though my doctor's office had told me yesterday when it was! I detest inefficiency, especially in professionals. THIS IS UNACCEPTABLE grom MEDICAL PROFESSIONALS! Makes me wonder if my surgery will be done under proper procedures from the facility??? Will I ever go back for amy services after Friday? I doubt it at this point. I jave dealt with medical.professionals personally for over 45 years and this is the worst I have EVER seen.

name: Waymond McGee
text: I, Waymond McGee, went to Riverview Medical Center in 2015 where Dr. Donald Marshall did a verbal sexual harassment towards me. I went through every possible channel to get this matter handled and I was rejected. Since no action was taken, I wanted to inform the public on this issue so this will not happen to anyone else.

name: Bravo Chakras
text: It's a really hospital. April at New Vision is very sweet, understanding, compassionate, and awesome. @NewVision  @gadsdenregionalhospital

name: April Myers
text: The staff was very caring. My poor mom suffered a lot and was a very difficult patient due to cancer in her brain and a lifetime of being stubborn and strong-willed. Despite her physical lashing out, pulling out her IV's and trying to go home every minute she was there, they were very kind and caring. When it was clear she was dying, they did everything they could to make us comfortable. I never ate so good as I did staying there 24/7 for a week. The seats turn into pretty comfortable beds. My only issue, and it is a significant one, is that there were a whole lot of specialists each focused on their specific area of medicine, and it didn't appear they were checking her file before they walked in. So we had a lot of bizarre and non-sensical testing trying to take place, and even in her last gasps, someone came in with a gurney to take her in for surgery. The neurosurgeon came in wondering why she hadn't gone in for the MRI that morning. The last few days, I felt like I really had to protect my mom because their system is so chaotic and overwhelming. Even if you say no to something, the word doesn't get to the everyone and they still try to do it. Don't leave your loved one there alone, whatever you do. They are going to need your care and oversight. I will never forget the kind people there, and especially the folks who prayed with my proud, fighter of a mom. She decided to accept Jesus the day before she died, I'm sure it helped having people like that around.

name: Marquita Ervin
text: What a nasty hospital.. that smell is mold... The State need to shut yall down

name: Terri Odazier
text: Awful.  Nasty and doctors dont know anything.  I had to tell him it was my gallbladder and even then he told me that was not the problem. I told him to do an ultrasound and with hesitation he ordered it.  Yep it was inflamed and full.  Stupid.  I had to do his job.  Now they want to change me 10k.

name: Regina Gallagher
text: Best hospital ever!Very fast service and very nice  staff!

name: ChopinLover
text: In spite of the five stars the nurse tech on duty afternoon 4/23/17 made slanderous remarks toward the spouse of her patient. These remarks are totally unwarranted. I may sue.

name: Carol Lee
text:
Recently my mother was admitted to CCU. She has been there a week and a day.
The nurses told us on Sunday that she would be moved to a regular room on Monday. Now that it is Tuesday she is STILL in CCU. Apparently, they are waiting on the Dr. I understand that there are alot of patients to be seen but waiting on the Dr. to just allow her to be moved is not acceptable. She has improved tremendously thanks to the CCU and alot of prayers. You would think that the Dr.would take 5 minutes or call CCU and order her to a regular room. If he is too busy then the hospital needs more physicians. Not a good experience.......

name: Brandon O'tinger
text:
Hated that hospital. My dad had his prostate removed there. The nurses did not pay attention to the compression devices placed on the calves of his legs. These are used to try to prevent deep vein thrombosis, but they never even bothered to check to lake sure they were working properly. My dad ended up with.deep vein thrombosis in both legs, and suffered bilateral pulmonary emboli as a result.

The elevators are awful, you literally have to sit there and wait, and wait, and wait for the elevator to arrive, seems like it takes 5 mi utes every time you use it. Also several times i thought we were going to get stuck in one because it was ridiculously slow, and rickety.

I absolutely would advise avoiding this facility unless absolutely neccessary.

name: Allen Elkins
text:
From their deplorable bedside manner to their decrepit facility; this hospital deserves some sort of negative star ranking.

I went to their emergency room where the Physician's Assistant (I believe his name is Brian) cut me off several times when I was speaking, wouldn't let me run off a list of symptoms I was experiencing, told me I couldn't come In there with more than a couple complaints; essentially an extremely rude individual. His demeanor was that of a cowboy cop (yes, mustach included) from a low budget action film based in the mid 1980s.

As a result of said negligence on Brian's part, I was prescribed medications for symptoms I never even stated.

Also, the doctor never even came in the room to see me. I was given a message from the doctor through one of the nurses that mirrored Brian's statement.

My overall perception of the Emergency Room visit was that I was an unwelcome burden.

The only good thing I can say about the hospital is the admitting staff, and nurses were very hospitable and kind.

text: Staff has been excellent and service has been exceptional!

text: Dr. Ashford delivered all three of my children and I’ve been going to him for years. Since 2009. However, the last few times I’ve been have not been the same. Extra staff has been added.  The front desk still the same , but the nurses, cnas that call you in the back are not friendly ,  vibe and attitude not right for a doctor’s office.   Today , like the last two times ; I waited an hour and a half to go in the back. The CNA that called me back..... eyes rolling like she had a problem and didn’t want to be there.   The back is too crowded, and unprofessional. Nurses everywhere but still slow. Really don’t feel like a doctors office at all. Not going back , changing my doctor. I rather go to the health department.

We set a high standard for ourselves and are truly sorry to hear that this standard was not met in your interaction with us. In an effort to resolve any issues that you may have had, someone from our office will be reaching out to you.

Thank you!

name: Meshia
text:
If I could have done this review without giving any stars, I would have. But, this star is for LaTory Franks. She really deserves all 5, but this review is not about her. Dr. Ashford has been my gynecologist for more than 10 years, so needless to say, I trusted him. He performed a surgery on me that in turned almost took my life, because he continued to diagnose me inaccurately from the pain I was having after the surgery. I ended up with sepsis, diverticulitis, and an ostomy bag. I have never had any marks on my body, not even my stomach, but after Dr. Ashford's surgery, my stomach looks like a train track with connect the dots around it. This sent me into a depressed state. I have to see this every day when I look at myself.
After which he had no remorse or concern for. He was always nice until he did something wrong. He acts as if he is some type of god with people lives in his hand. But, everyone has to answer to THE MOST HIGH GOD!! I would definitely not refer my worst enemy, let along family, friends, or associates to him or cahaba medical. Even after I did my grievance report concerning this issue, and was notified that his attorneys told him to contact me, to this day, nothing has been done, and, no one from cahaba medical has contacted me since, because they don't care either.

name: Alyssa Rushton
text: Cahaba Medical came to BCHS to administer our vaccinations. My first experience with their staff was amazing. The nurse was extremely polite and answered all of my questions. The second nurse seemed to be a bit dismissive of my questions and would not give me eye contact. I am sure after vaccinating so many employees in one day it became routine to her. However, I would like to express my gratitude to the staff that took the time to show care and concern. I know it is not an easy task, and I had no side effects with the 1st round and very little to none with the 2nd round. I appreciate their staff for being so accommodating to the needs of our school system.  I have lost 2 people that are very dear to me since March of 2020 due to COVID-19. One was a 75 year old mother and grandmother, and another dear friend younger than myself. I appreciate the opportunity to be vaccinated during this scary time.

name: Dawn Carignan
text: Dr. Doucette and team saved my life!! It was a hard decision to make but I did it. Alabama Surgical is amazing. I felt like I had one foot in the grave and now I’m in such a better spot medically. I no longer need BP meds and I’m not diabetic. I’ve lost 81lbs and I feel GREAT!!! The staff here have been exceptional and caring. I feel like they are on this journey with me and really wants me to succeed in my NEW life. I’m no longer surviving but LIVING. THANK YOU ALABAMA SURGICAL

name: Brandi Flynn
text:
Dr. Doucette and staff truly went above and beyond! They are very educational,  caring and thoughtful
My life was saved and forever made so much better through Alabama surgical associates.  I've lost 118 pounds in less than 1 year with no complications. I highly recommend Alabama Surgical Associates!

name: Lara Hook
text: This process was very easy for me.  I am happy that I was able to have it done by Dr. Doucette.  He was great and his staff and team are amazing.

name: Dean Kolden
text: Staff was very friendly. Services were reasonably priced.

name: Samantha Allred
text: I am an out of state, cash paying bariatric surgical patient approaching my one year anniversary of my VSG surgery. Dr. Doucette, RD Caroline and the rest of the team have helped me regain control of my life and my health. I am healthier than I have ever been in my entire adult life. I highly highly recommend this group. The level of care not only with the staff but also the hospital they chose was leaps and bounds better than any care I have received here at home in Indiana. If I had to do it all over again, I absolutely would.

name: Mandy Thompson
text: I am 11 months post op from VSG, Dr Doucette and his dietitian Macey are great. Very knowledgeable in their fields. Anytime I have ever had a question or concern, I email them and usually get a pretty prompt response within 24 hours. So grateful to the BOTH of them for giving me this new tool to better my health and life.

name: Celina Lambeth
text: Dr. Doucette and his staff are amazing. I was always a priority when in the building. All of my questions were answered and they took their time with my appointments. My surgery went beautifully and my scars are perfect. Once healed, you wont be able to tell they are there. Dr. Doucette knows his stuff and fully explained the procedure, as well as his expectations for me. I am motivated to keep pushing forward, now that I have a clear defined goal before me, designed by my doctor. No complaints whatsoever.

name: Harold Turner
text: They really get to work at night clean place friendly staff really takes of their patience

name: Shannon Vasquez
text: The staff was amazing. Dr Doucette is a wonderful surgeon. I am so thankful to have had this life changing procedure. The staff at the Crestwood Hospital was top notch. The entire experience has been great. I live 4.5 hours away and the staff is very supportive and quick to respond.

name: Crystal Miller
text: Dr. Foreman and staff are absolutely wonderful! Easy to deal with and they make the process a whole lot easier with their knowledge.  I would highly recommend Dr. Foreman and his entire office to anyone!

name: Guru Guru
text: The doctor needs to seriously take a look at his "coordinator" and "insurance processor," they are so negative and I am SURE he's losing a lot of business/patients just from the initial call!! I couldn't get off the phone fast enough to call the next available bariatric doctor!! Felt so sorry for the little girl who was trying to schedule my appointment/consultation and was relaying the messages between the insurance person, coordinator and myself, if I didn't know any better, I would of thought they were PISSED OFF at the doctor and didn't want him to have anymore patients, HONESTLY that's HOW BAD IT WAS!!!!!! No to EVERYTHING, no positive energy WHATSOEVER!! Coordinator fee went from $100 to $300 within 45 seconds....👀👀👀👀

name: Barbiewants 2beme
text: TERRIBLY RUDE STAFF! I have to say this is the most unprofessional staff i have ever met. I live over 2.5 hours away and made appointments for procedures on a wed and thurs which me and my husband both had to take off work for because it was the only day that dr. doucett did the procedure and i would need a driver. I paid for a hotel (200) for wed night so we could stay in huntsville for the procedure the next day. I was called by the center that i was suppose to have my procedure done ( 2pm on wed ) at 6am on wed wanting to know where i was. Well i had not been informed that my time had changed. I spoke with the office twice on friday and once on monday before the procedure and was never informed. I called the office at 845 and was spoken to so rudely by christina (christin something like that) . that i have canceled all my future appointments. I am out 1200$( days missed working , hotel fees, and the cost of the labs and everything i had done before this, for this procedure..and that is just this trip) for this office mistakes but was talked to so rudely and disrespectful. I have been in the medical field 25 years and would never speak to a patient like that especially when it was this offices error. I highly recommend looking elsewhere for a surgeon if the staff is this rude to dr foreman patients.  I will be filing a complaint with the state board and following up with a lawyer also.I wish i had of read the reviews before making appointments with this office this seems to be an ongoing problem for this practice

name: Kevin McCullouch
text: Just wanted to say how much I appreciate everyone in the office. Especially Kathy Alnut in the insurance department. I felt like I bugged her to death trying to get everything squared away. She was on top of everything at all times. (Give her a raise) lol....I started my process the end of January I believe and I have my surgery March 25th 2019 with Dr. Foreman and I am so ready. Thanks to the ladies for making everything smooth sailing.

name: Kristine Watts
text: $220 wasted for a 5 minute consult with the Dr who tries to upsale you different procedures. After sitting in the room alone for an 1hr and 45 minutes.

name: Denise Scott
text: Very happy with my experience here everyone is so nice and caring.

name: Diamond In The Sky
text: Most reviews are positive for this practice, this may be the case for the doctors, but every staff member that I spoke with over the phone at Alabama Surgical Associates were very rude, as if I was bothering them.

name: Samantha Roberson
text: For the past two days I have been given the run around on getting a work excuse for my covid testing. I was told I should have requested one at the time of the testing even though I asked is there any paperwork I needed and they said no. I sat on hold bouncing back and forth between 3 people for 27 minutes when I was finally told I had to have someone bring my ID and their ID to pick it up. My uncle sat there for 46 minutes waiting when they said it was ready for pick up. As soon as he left they called me and said it was almost ready and no one was here to recieve it. I said they had been waiting for almost an hour on the paper yall said was ready in the first phone call. She then said she was having problems with the printer and she'd call me when it was ready. I never recieved a call back. I called this morning to see if it was ready the woman on the phone said anyone can pull it up and print it out for me but someone will have to come in and get it for me. So my 74 year old grandmother is the only person available so when we get there I tell her what to do she calls me and tells me they said we have to wait until the nurse gets here because she's the only person who can pull the file. What the hell is wrong with this place? There's no communication with anyone working their the people working their clearly have no idea what to do and if i lose my job due to franklin medical mall's incompetence I will be suing.

name: Svetlana Novoselschi
text: Dr.Semma is very rude and doesn’t listen to anything you say.She only stuck her head out during an appointment and said are you okay good bye. I don’t recommend anyone this clinic I would giver 0 stars if I could.

name: WK Jones
text: Miss the previous pharmacists (they have been gone over a year) and their team. These new people are rude and never helpful. They are a poor reflection of Publix’s. I can take once but they are always rude and act like you are bothering them. Moving my prescriptions...

name: Elizabeth Ewing
text: If I have not written a review for the Publix Pharmacy on Winchester, then I have been remiss. I have been getting my prescriptions and flu shots here for at least 10 yrs. The pharmacy, which is managed by Will Yates, is fantastic! I feel like they are family! I appreciate how quickly they fill prescriptions and provide text messages with the status of the prescriptions when they are ready. AND, I get text messages to remind me if it is time to refill my prescriptions! AND, I can go online to refill them! The employees there are empathetic, caring and knowledgeable! I hope they realize how appreciated they are, not just by me, but by other people! Keep up the great work! I highly recommend this pharmacy! Thank you!

name: Corey Steele
text: I have gone here to fill my prescription the last few months and have always paid roughly $40 for my medication. I go here today and was told that it would be $160. Only reason being is that "the manager chooses not to accept any coupons." No GoodRx or even the coupon from the website that my doctor used to send the prescription electronically. I ran out today, have to work a 10 hour shift in the morning, and I can't work without my medication. So I was basically forced to pay an extra $120. I am fuming. Who does this person think they are to not let someone use something to help them get what they need? This is one of the worst "because I said so" scenarios I've ever encountered. I want a refund of my $120 that was unnecessarily spent and I'm calling in a complaint to corporate. The employees I dealt with were nice and I understand their position, but whoever this manager is needs to reevaluate themselves.

name: Terri Beachum
text: I’ve been dealing with Publix pharmacy for a long, long time. Recently, I had a bad experience with a pharmacy employee being rude and interrupting me when I was asking what my options were due to a medication being out of stock. I’m not sure who this employee is because I have never spoken to her before. I was very disappointed in the customer service, which has never been as bad as this encounter was.

name: Mariusz Dusza
text: Very helpful stuff!

name: Tobin Hutto
text: The publix pharmacy that really looks out for you. The entire crew is professional AND pleasant to deal with!

name: Theodis Barnes III
text: Everyone is always nice and everything I'm looking for is always in stock and very neat. Not the best on price, not the worse either.

name: Mathew Sikes
text:
Said they do not accept coupons on "controlled" meds. This is the first time I've run into this issue... Below is an excerpt from goodrx website on the matter.
Pharmacies listed on GoodRx are contractually obligated to honor most coupons we display. However, discounts for controlled substances are honored at the discretion of the individual pharmacy or pharmacist. We are unable to require a pharmacy to fill the prescription or accept the coupon for a controlled medication, but the vast majority of pharmacies will honor coupons for controlled substances, and all pharmacies listed on GoodRx continue to honor GoodRx coupons and discount cards for controlled substances on an individual basis.

So they just choose to take unnecessary money from me and my family. For what reason?

name: Patricia Moore
text: The appointment was for my 90 year old mother.  We spoke a few minutes after her return to Keestone Assisted Living. She was so happy to have found you all. She said she got a thorough exam and felt as though each person took their time with her. She got different medicine and feels hopeful her symptoms will improve. It was so good to hear her so upbeat about a doctor visit!

name: Deb Stidham Avery
text: Kind, courteous and knowledgeable. Having had a Meniere's attack earlier that morning, I was still unsteady and feeling disoriented. I couldn't have been treated better, especially with not being able to hear well. And I left with a helpful plan!  This was my first visit here and I would highly recommend staff and doctor..

Thank you for taking time to leave us a review. We are so glad you had a great experience!

text:
Very knowledgeable and ready to help.  Dr Masterson operated to repair a deviated septum and collapsed valve.  I can now breathe efficiently out of both sides of my nose.  One side of my nose was completely obstructed.  I also got my hearing checked there on two occasions.  I forget her name but she is very personable, professional, and has many years of experience.
I'm extremely impressed with Dr Masterson and his staff!

text:
Everthing was excellent until I found drugstore did not have call in prescription for drops for my infected ear.  I called in as was told by nurse Medicare would not pay for what Dr had prescribed, she would have to wait to talk to Dr to get different presc.  Would call it in the next day.

I pointed out it was for an INFECTED ear, I needed to start drops that day, not next day.

She did not seem to see any urgency in my getting drops that day, seemed not concerned that it would be even worse if couldn’t start until next day.

She finally relented, said she would talk to Dr after he finished appts, and did call it in.

Unusual experience for this excellent operation.

Had a great experience. I was very nervous about my visit. I have been having nose bleeds for over 2 months . I found out that I had an autoimmune disease ( during my cancer) it’s called ITP basically my blood doesn’t clot and it can make me be more or less a free bleeder ( BUMMER .. hence the 2mth of bleeding ) Which some may not be aware but this can cause such HAVOC ON YOUR BODY.

The team was kind and Dr Materson was Very gentle and although YES it was uncomfortable ( of course) he was so easy with me . So far I haven’t seen any more bleeding .

Thank You All

resp.text:

Thank you for your kind words. You are very important to us and we’re so glad you had a wonderful experience. Thank you again.

name: Ashley Hardy
text: Dr Masterson is a careful attentive doctor who truly cares about his patients. The staff are so friendly and helpful!

resp.text:
Dear Ashley,
Thank you for taking the time to leave such great feedback. We're so glad you had a great experience and we look forward to working with you again.

name: Jonathan Hardy
text: I’ve battled congestion and sinus infections my whole life. After speaking with Dr Masterson, we decided to have my tonsils removed and I can say I feel WAY better. I had no idea something as simple as tonsils would be affecting me that much. I am so thankful I did it and wish I would’ve done that 20 years ago! All that to say, huge props to this dr. I definitely recommend this ENT center if you need help or have questions / concerns with your health.

resp.text:
Dear Jonathan,
Thanks for your awesome review! We work hard to meet expectations like yours and we’re happy to hear we hit the mark. Would you mind sharing your awesome experience with a friend? We’d love to provide quality healthcare services for them, too. Thank you again!

name: Andrew Alonso
text: Dr. Masterson and his friendly staff are a welcomed resource to The Shoals area for ear, nose and throat medical services.

resp.text:
Dear Andrew,
Thank you for your kind words. We work very hard to provide high quality care and service for everyone. Thanks again!

name: Julia Johnson
text: Very conscientious doc and staff.

resp.text:
Dear Julia,
Thank you for taking the time to leave such great feedback. We're so glad you had a great experience and we look forward to working with you again.

name: Ronald Stewart
text: Not a patient but know the physicians!! Great doctors!

resp.text:
Dear Ronald,
Thank you for your kind words. We work very hard to provide high quality care and service for everyone. Thanks again!

name: Brian Cameron
text: Nurses are very nice.

resp.text:
Dear Brian,
Thank you for taking the time to leave such great feedback. We're so glad you had a great experience and we look forward to working with you again.

name: Bill Beard
text: I have been a patient of Dr. Loren McCoy for 6 years and I have received excellent care from Dr. McCoy and his staff.  Unlike many doctors I have had in the past, he actually listens to his patients and explains things well.  I highly recommend him as a general practitioner.

resp.text: Thanks, Bill! I'll get your check in the mail today! LOL

name: Vickie Vaughn
text: Dr. Parker staff is very nice to me. Cannot  wait to have my first appointment with him next week. Just blood work today!! I can do this!! 😊😊

name: Lisa Quinn
text: Dr Parker is a wonderful Doctor and friend. Sometimes I do get aggravated with his staff I feel they are more concerned with getting off on time or not having to work too hard. He has NEVER made me feel I wasn't important.

resp.text: Thank you Lisa. I promise that my staff cares very much about you and all of our patients, but I am working on making sure we are more efficient and timely; while always being caring and compassionate.

name: robert lafrance
text:
Just moved to area and Avalon was referred by insurance company.
I have been calling at all hours of the business hours posted and continually get vmail.
I did finally get a reply to emails as well requesting my telephone number but still have not heard from anyone.
I would not go to this office because if they can’t answer phones or email requests then I wonder what service will be like if I became a patient????

name: Kimmie Bohannon
text: Do not come here to see Dr. Laura Lindsey. After moving offices, her office sent me to voice mail for two weeks. I was trying to make an appointment, because I was running low on my antidepressants. She refused to give me an emergency prescription for just the seven days until my newly scheduled appointment. Insisting that I needed to be seen before I received my prescription I’ve been on for a year. I’ve had to sacrifice my mental health, and ration my medicine. I have major depressive disorder and generalized panic disorder. I am so upset with the employees of Avalon Medical Group. They put my well being at risk. I will never be coming back and I will advocate for the use of any other doctors, as I can only assume they’ll treat you the same way.

name: Paul Smith
text: They have turned in to a factory since going into their new building.  If you are sick, lots of luck.  You can't get an appointment for 3-4 weeks.  They don't handle walk-ins.  Their advice, "call 911 or go to the emergency room", another $90 on most medical plans.  Most of the time you only get to see a nurse and there is no time to discuss anything with a Dr.  It's all about "Ka-ching".

name: suzyk
text: Dr. Heinkel, professional, caring doctor I can count on.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  All of our doctors strive to give the best care!

name: Alisha Monique Darby
text: Good Christian doctors and nurses. Very caring and they remember my name and my family's names too.Prompt service and very thorough. They saved my life many times. Keep up the good work.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We truly appreciate you as a person and a patient.

name: Brian Cameron
text: Dr McCoy and his staff will take great care of you.

resp.text: Thank you, Brian! We appreciate you and your faith in us!

name: Judy Patterson
text: Dr. McCoy

resp.text: Thank you, Judy!

name: Josh Bowen
text: Dr. Heinkel and his staff set the bar for quick, professional, and thorough treatment. Everyone is treated with kindness and dignity.

name: MARIO P
text: Med pluse is cheaper

name: Charlie Kuhn
text: Love Doctor Pickett - the whole staff, efficient, no long waits, Dr. Pickett truly listens and is passionate about her work

name: Boe Jane
text: Dr. Pickett is very rude. I went a few times and asked about my back pain, I guess she doesn't know what she's doing because she didn't help me, she ignored me and brushed off my question, she also ignored my questions about Disability and told me I don't look like I need to be on Disability when she doesn't have the say on my struggles and back pain since she didn't care to check it. The ladies in the back lab that does blood work are so stuck up and privileged, I guess they don't like Black people? The energy there is awful and rude. Do not go there. It's not worth it and if you don't have insurance, you'd end up paying way too much money for her lame services.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to review our clinic. Dr. Pickett is no longer with our group

name: Dan Lee
text: Long wait times,  lack of facilities. Id go somewhere else.

resp.text: Not sure what you mean by long wait times and lack of facilities as we are essentially a one-stop facility for most patients. Also it appears you have never actually been seen as a patient here.

name: Jane Otp
text: The 1st time I met Dr. Meredith Pickett  she was OK, turns out she's fake! the more visits I had with her the more rude,& fake she became! The ladies in the back that draw blood have nasty attitudes, even when I said "Hello" , they ignored me. Dr. Pickett doesn't listen! I told her I have knee and back pain but she ignored me, Told her about my eye pain, she ignored that as well, AND she messed up my medication! I told her nicely some need to be filled at WalMart and other at Publix, but she put then in at publix. Maybe she's racist? BUT I'M NEVER, EVER GOING BACK!

resp.text: Dr. Pickett is no longer with our group

name: Carolanne Kuhn
text: Highly unprofessional and borderline negligent.  Dr. Jonathan Parker after rescheduling my initial appointment and re-scheduling over 1 month out - a few days before my appointment they called to tell me he can not take on a new patient!!!  I have prescriptions which need to refilled and an MRI which was to be completed and now I have no primary doctor! !!  Reporting them to the Alabama Medical Board

resp.text: I apologize for any inconvenience. Dr. Parker was overwhelmed with request when Dr. Pickett. Because patient care is the utmost importance and he could not spend the time with patient that he wished he suggested that patient be seen by other partners. He offered to fill medications for 30 days and fulfill other obligations. Sorry he never saw you as a patient after Dr. Pickett left.

name: Jason Smallwood
text: Dr Pickett is a good doctor

name: B Gram
text: I have always had a good experience. Every pharmacist/tech is very pleasant to be around. They fill the prescriptions in a timely manner. They are always over worked and short handed, but still manage to get the job done. They are also opened on Sundays which is a plus. Beats the hell out of mom and pop pharmacies around here.

name: masta t
text: Great prices on prescriptions.

name: La Donna Griffin
text: I use this pharmacy, also, for some of the meds I have to pay for, these meds are on the reduced price list.  The pharmacist are always really friendly, & fast at getting your medicine ready if u forget to call your refills in before you go.   Also,  my diabetes medicine, Metformin, is free at Publix, they also have a few antibiotics that a patient can get for free, just have to check the list, or the Dr can do it since, of course, you have to have a prescription.  I recommend Publix pharmacy, also.

name: Courtney Bennett
text: Live this store. Its has more variety than the one in Gardendale.

name: Mandy Shea Riggins
text: Ridiculously helpful.

name: donnie collins
text: Yeah.

name: Jeff Franklin
text:
Absolutely the worst patient processing timing ever.
Took mother due to awful pain in back. 2 1/2 hour wait to see doctor Heck. We got there 15 minutes before the scheduled time to be there. I am sure if we missed it they would want to charge for missing schedule. I am totally fed up with doctors that over schedule and then want to charge you if you are late. Not sure if I would go back if doctor recommended him. “Heck” I am not sure if he will show up!

Inexcusable for that type of waiting, especially when it is a back doctor.

name: Andrea F.
text:
Dr Heck saved my life.  Went to the ER at another hospital before seeing him and they thought I was trying to get drugs since I was complaining about back pain.  Dr heck took me seriously and did surgery even though my MRI wasn’t that bad.  Found out during surgery that I had a rare condition with abnormal nerves in my back. He said he sees this condition about every 2 years. The abnormal nerves were causing the pain - I felt like I was being electrocuted.
He also later performed a back surgery on my mother. Her back is much better now.  We were worried about her surviving the surgery due to her health.  She had a rough recovery - but overall her back is much better.  Highly recommend Heck.

resp.text: Amazing story, Andrea! Thank you so much for sharing it with us, and we're thrilled to hear about you and your family's outcomes. We'll make sure your praise is known to Dr. Heck and the whole team.

name: Janice Woodard
text:
Dr. Heck was very nice n very knowledgeable about my concerns. We are going to try an option that has not ever been brought to my attention. I hope n pray it works.
Dr. Heck did give me some Hope for my back problems.

resp.text: Hi, Janice. Thank you for the wonderful review! We're glad you had a great experience.

name: Delinda Morris
text: I was very pleased with my first visit with Dr.Heck and staff.  All were very caring and professional. Dr. Heck answered all my questions and made me feel at ease.Thank you all so much!

name: Kristy Griffie
text: My experience at Southlake has been nothing but pleasant. Dr. Heck is awesome. He explains everything to you where you can understand. The staff is nice also.

name: Melissa Gilley
text: He is a very caring doctor, that tells you all the goods and bads of surgery. It lays it all out there for you and that I really appreciate that honesty. It doesn’t take long to get an appointment with Dr. Heck and the staff is fantastic. And you don’t have to sit and wait to see the doctor for appointment.

name: Tim Carter
text: I had a good experience at this office during the pandemic.  Checkin was quick and easy on a electronic kiosk that read my drivers license, insurance card, and credit card copay.The reception was nearby to answer questions and the seating area was set up for social distancing.  Everyone wore masks.  It was a short wait to be examined.  Xrays were done in the office.  I had a good experience.

name: Deanie Penney
text: Overall favorable However I called yesterday afternoon and got Heather’s voicemail. She is the one I need to talk to but I didn’t hear from her yesterday afternoon so need to talk to her Monday for sure!

name: Team Grind 2023
text: Went to Dr. Hecks for a second opinion for the issues and pain associated with my neck. He took time to explain why I was having the pain and also my options to fix my issue, he never acted like he was in a hurry. The staff was also very friendly and attentive plus I didn’t have to wait long. Overall is was a very good experience.

name: Linda Lowery
text: I would advice doing all paperwork online before you arrive by doing so I was called back right after I Signed in. The nurse was very sweet asked a few questions and told me that Dr.Heck would be right in which he was. He was very nice and to the point as to what he needed to get my treatment started waiting on a test to be scheduled. And he will call me with the results.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback.

name: HONEYDOVE 》5
text: Great staff, great nurses, and a great Doctor. I have had nothing but good experiences everytime I have gone. Including my surgery. Every one is so nice and goes above and beyond to help you. I could not ask for sweeter, kind-hearted, helpful people. I'm just sorry it took me a while to find them. But at least I have them now. I recommend them to anyone needing them...

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback.  Our goal is to provide great patient care!

name: Treck
text: Seen the issues at hand had a plan of care. Let me make my own choice while giving me informed risk/benefits for going towards one plan or the other.

name: LaToya Williams
text: My first time here. The Nurses were smiling, very friendly. Dr. Heck, definitely listened to me. He was very professional. Explained n detailed my diagnosis. I will be back! 😉⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

name: Rose Foster
text: I was taken very good care of by the staff. Dr. Heck took time out to listen and explain my options.  Plus I was in and out in a timely manner.

name: Larry Connell
text: Dr Heck did a fusion of the L5 and S1. After I woke up, all the pain in my leg and hip was gone. He listen to everything I said and ask and answered every question. His office staff and PA Laura is also GREAT!  Glad God sent him to me. Great experience!

name: Judy Young
text: Dr.Heck and his staff was very professional making a severe back problem not as scary as it could have been. Looking forward to the next visit.

name: Brent Curtin
text: If you are in need of back surgery, do not hesitate to use Dr Heck. Dr.Heck and his team makes you feel comfortable and they don’t stop working until you are back in good health. I appreciate everyone at Southlake including Dr Craig. I highly recommend Southlake.

name: Lee Anderson
text: Had an appointment with Southlake's back surgeon, Dr. Heck, after surgery. Everything progressing on time and feeling better every day. Thanks Dr. Heck!!

name: Michael Schleinkofer
text: Horrible doctor.  Couldn’t diagnose my pinched spinal cord even though the MRI stated it clearly.

name: demetra sarris
text: Wonderful staff.  Dr. Heck listened to my problems.  Very satisfied with procedure he ordered, etc.  Would highly recommend him.

name: Ellen Wohlgemuth
text: Dr Heck was very helpful in explaining the problem I have and the necessary procedure to alleviate the problem. I highly recommend him. His staff was very professional and kind

name: JoAnne Bernard
text: This man is AMAZING !!! He is truly a gift from God !!! He saved me and brought me back to my family !!! No more pain and completely drug free for the first time in 10 years !!!

name: Sheila Sealy
text: Dr. Heck is an exceptional doctor.  I would trust him with any of my needs or my family's needs.

name: Tasha Ambers
text: Dr. Christopher Heck is absolutely the WORST  orthopedic surgeon in Alabama!  Due to his incompetence, a simple disc herniation has resulted in me being disabled. What should have been a three week recovery has now been more than three years with no recovery!  He performed a second surgery and now I need a third.  After two years, and I decided to let God handle him and not sue him, he got very rude with me and told me he did not want to see me anymore and less I want another surgery. After countless procedures and  thousands of dollars in physical therapy, (22 weeks all together) I will now live with his incompetent error!  He definitely lives up to his name! He’s not worth a HECK!!!!

name: Leigh Pearson
text: Dr. Christopher Heck is so amazing!  He has performed a discectomy for my sister (herniated disc with a conjoined nerve root that he found during surgery, that was causing more pain than just a herniated disc would cause).  She is doing fantastic!  He also performed a fusion from L3/L4 to L5/S1 for my mother who suffers from severe spinal stenosis.  She went from a wheelchair to a walker, and the walker is only because she has neuropathy in both feet!  I cannot say enough about how wonderful this man is!  And he’s not only a smart and talented surgeon, but he’s kind and takes the time to listen to his patients (and their caregivers)!

resp.text: I appreciate the feedback you provided!

name: Angela Thornburg
text:
Dr. Heck is "The DOCTOR" to go see. He is personable, doesn't forget what is going on with you. He explains all procedures in detail with words and explanations that you understand.
With having 3 back surgeries before i was referred by Dr. Lawler from Oxford Alabama. My back kept becoming worse and the pain got to the point I couldnt take it anymore after hurting for about 6 years. Dr. Heck told me that he could help me but i had to have a long and extensive back surgery that was about 5 to 6 hours long. I was ready for anything and I left his office that day confident he would help me.
Dr. Heck came out 3 times during the surgery to speak to my husband to let him know how I was doing, and where he was in the surgery. That meant so much to my husband and me that he had that much consideration not to leave my husband wondering what was going on.
I came out of surgery that day PAINFREE, after 6 years of constant hurting.  I was Up walking around the hospital floor on the second day feeling like wonder woman, I went home on the 3rd day. I can also walk straight and stand straight. That was a bonus that I didn't know that could be fixed.
Everyone from the nurse care in recovery, the nurses there on the floor that took the most gentle and sweet care of me. The sweet people that brought your food, the folks that came to your room to get your food order, to the sweet sweet girls that cleaned my room were a joy to be around. GREAT HOSPITAL!!
Both of Dr Heck's office staff are great and attentive.  They Call You Right Back, friendly, and they get you right in to see him.
I can't say enough great things about Dr. Heck and his staff.  Go see him and get your hurting fixed by a Great Doctor!!! All I can say is Thank God for Dr. Heck because I can't say enough of good about him.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the review.

name: Sherrie Dawson
text: Was very fast at the time didn't have to wait long and the staff was great.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback!

name: Nadine Hollingsworth
text: Very professional and caring. I would highly recommend him and Grandview Medical Hospital.

name: syber and diys
text: The staff was so very friendly and the Dr. Heck was so very thorough in breaking down to me in simple words on what was going on with my body and the corrected actions that was needed to be done.

name: Connie Dunaway
text: Had Spinal Cord Stimulator Doctor done a great Job

name: Lee Anderson
text: Dr. Heck was very good at analyzing my back problem and then explaining with a plastic back the problems I was having in a language that I could understand, not “Doctor talk”. Then he explained the options available to me and the pros and cons of each and then his recommendation. Well worth the drive to BHM from MGM.

name: kayce Hill
text: Great experience

name: erica square
text: I didn't have a pleasant experience I feel like he wasn't really concerned with what was going on with me. He was in and out no compassion and could careless about what I had going on.

resp.text: Sorry you found your visit to be unpleasant, our goal is to provide exceptional patient care to the best of our ability to every patient.

name: Kasey Lowery
text:
Very friendly staff excellent check in experience
Dr heck was excellent

name: Chris Fugatt
text: I went to different doctors trying to find out what was going on with my back,  Dr. Heck done what needed to be done to find out what was going on. Now I will be having surgery thanks to Dr. Heck

name: Floyd Drennon
text: God's right hand man.

name: Charles Woodall
text: Long wait time due to doc being in surgery. Very satisfied with consult.

name: Sam Robertson
text: He immediately & accurately found my spine problem that had been incorrectly diagnosed by others. His staff are friendly & professional.

name: Gail Lyon
text: Very pleased with Dr. Heck and staff.

resp.text: Thank you for the review.  Appreciate the feedback!

name: debbie reed
text: I've never experienced such caring and personable people as I was lucky enough to find at this pharmacy. Taylor is truly an ANGEL. They treat me like family. Publix AND Gulf Shores are lucky to have them. Thanks y'all

name: Tammy
text: I won't use any other pharmacy here.  It makes a difference when you KNOW your pharmacist and technicians care about YOU.

name: Ron Langley
text: Grocery is great, pharmacy is very rude, act as though they are doing you a favor allowing you purchase medications from them. Walgreens has a new customer. Large turnover of pharmacists and techs ,  never had a problem until recently.

name: me to you
text: Staff remembers my name when I go in for a prescripton. They are all very nice and respectful.

name: Rickie Masias
text: I dont have insurance and publix pharmacy fills my meds free of charge thank you so much otherwise i wouldn't be able to get my prescription filled

name: Fred Griffin
text: Great place to shop and very friendly, helpful employees.

name: Robert Walker
text: Always fast

name: Houston Huggins II
text: New to the area. This is, without question- the WORST patient care experience I have ever had! The doctor is completely detached from the patient care process. She is a condescending narcissistic clock watcher. There was no information about my supplies prescription given to me. I am ashamed to say that I waited 6 weeks to reach out to the sleep center to find out where my supplies were-but then I was told who the supplier was and that I had to make contact with them and go get the supplies. DON'T MAKE THE SAME MISTAKE I MADE....DON'T WASTE YOUR VALUABLE TIME.....DON'T GO HERE!

resp.text: Hello, Mr. Huggins. We're so sorry to hear that you had a negative experience with one of our physicians. Please consider calling the Patient Advocate so we can learn more about your concerns and work to address them. The advocate can be reached at (256) 265-9449.

name: Simeon
text: Staff is very nice and answered all of my questions.

name: Anna Valentine
text: I have been using this pharmacy for about 5 years. They always get my meds filled quickly and correctly. However, the person I spoke to on the phone today was extremely rude. Her name was Hannah. She kept cutting me off while I was trying to talk and she had a condescending tone to her voice. She acted as if I was bothering her by asking a simple question about my prescription. Which is unacceptable as it is HER job to answer these questions. If I hadn't already dropped my prescription off, I would be taking it somewhere else. Everyone else is very kind but her .You are in the business of treating and providing a service to people who are most likely sick or have an on going condition that makes life hard enough without you having a nasty attitude. If you cant do that it may be time to find a new profession. Next time, it would be wise to LISTEN ans WAIT to answer the question until it has been fully asked.

name: Jeremiah Cannon
text:
Well, it’s at least better than the Calera CVS. Most of them there are friendly!
More often than not they don’t have prescriptions ready for hours after they’re called in. It’s not like they’re manufacturing it, they are literally just COUNTING to 20 or 30, etc. Half the time when it is ready, they can’t find it.
Example: Doctor sent in 2 prescriptions at once, I received a text that it was ready. Went to pick it up 3 HOURS after they text only to find out that they had only filled 1, not the other. Why would you not fill both at the same time, or at least within 3 HOURS when they come across at the same time?! Why send a notification when you’ve only done half your job, for me to have to drive out there twice (whilst having to load up a toddler and an infant both times)? Like I said, just the latest example. But at least they are nice for the most part.

name: Maegan Gates
text: Always great customer service and experience at this Publix. Love the employees and the pharmacy. Always get great assistance and very polite employees who make conversation and genuinely seem to care.

name: Nikki Sutton
text:
I normally do not leave reviews. However, if I could give Publix Pharmacy in Calera, AL A BIG FAT 0; I would!
Horrible customer service. Pharmacy techs are continuously rude. Clearly NO LEADERSHIP with management in the pharmacy department!
If I felt better right now I would go into details......

name: Natalie Rodriguez
text:
I ❤ this Pharmacy.

Hardest working staff l ever 👀.

I have been to just about all the Pharmacy chains companies + some local ones.

25 years of  💊 in 3 states, many 🌆 and towns.
(my body loves to give 🩺 something 👩‍🔬on)

Back to the subject.

I've🧳alway to different locations.
Nothing will cause me to leave this CALERA Publix's Pharmacy.
Even if I may have to fight
⏲,🚦, 🚧 , 🚛🚕🚙 to come here, its all worth it, to have all my💊s needs and questions handle by this "Exceptional."
Winning🎰 Pharmacy's STAFF and the 🥇Pharmacy's Management👩‍💼👩‍💼team!!!
Always 🎰 Service!

I just 🧘‍♂️ & trust, they will  keep an 👁 on all my Healthcare's needs.

name: Jeremy Currie
text: Employee are very nice!  I had an issue and Debbie followed up and fixed the issue. Thanks!

name: Fulton Ramsay
text: Takes care of you.

name: Jessica Tucker
text: This Publix Pharmacy has excellent customer service.

name: Amanda Bradley
text: I was on a list for discount blood pressure meds. The list ended the price went up and I had to have it. They could have told people an experation date

name: Ryan Hand
text: They are the best. Very helpful and easy to get to from the interstate. I get them to steam shrimp for me weekly and they are always happy to do it. This is my preferred grocery shopping location.

name: Courtney Freeman
text: Great customer service! Very organized & clean. Awesome prices

name: Lacey Kendall
text: Customer service is always fantastic here! However, I continually have a problem with buying expired food. Come on folks, check your inventory and remove the stuff that’s expired! I willingly pay more to shop at Publix for the customer service. It’s your job to keep expired stuff off the shelves! I don’t routinely check expiration dates on pantry items. And it’s almost always on a specialty or organic item, so it’s expensive! Please make more of an effort to keep only in-date items on your shelves!

name: ryan dean
text: Excellent store! Wonderful company. Shopping here truly is a pleasure.

name: Robert Key
text: The place has wonderful customer service and I have never had an issue but I all ways wonder why no one there seems happy, more like a fake happy. Note to management, people can hear the conversations you have with your employees. Easy up a tad guys.

name: J.M. E.
text: Just wanted to say that although I don't shop at Publix very often I went in this morning feeling really crappy. Their staff was overwhelmingly friendly and helpful. I figured they needed a shout-out because it seems everyone only leaves reviews when they're upset. So, you guys that were working at 8am this morning were AWESOME!

name: N. Hope
text: The staff is exceptional! They've gone out of there way several times to assist my family and I with recent insurance changes. Wouldn't go anywhere else!!!

name: Nancy Lacey
text: I would like to thank Sheris Harper for helping us by opening a register for us to checkout. There was only one regular cashier open and she saw the need immediately and jumped in to help us as well as the line that had formed. She exemplified customer service at it best. We drive 20 miles, one way, in order to shop at your store. Thanks again Sheris 👏🏻👏🏻

name: Clay HeyHey
text: Great publix. Great staff. Once my battery died and a young guy up front offered to jump me off when he overheard my dilemma.

name: Rachel Gladden
text: Every employee is always extremely kind and courteous! Above and beyond vs. Those no eye contact, just getting paycheck stores :)

name: Yologsolive Kennedy
text: Good food and deli love to go and get new recipes. And I love their seafood options.

name: A Ruffino
text: Publix Pharmacy has the best staff .. I've used them for 13 years, they know me by name & take care of all my needs & questions ..

name: Amy Lynn Butler
text: Always very friendly, always so helpful! I did not realize how great this Publix was until I went to another close location in Alabaster.

name: Penny Palmer
text: Just a wonderful, friendly, warm store. The employees are super helpful and I love shopping there.

name: Steven Mooney
text: Well, it's basically your only option in the area.  Good thing it's a great store!

name: R Ramsay
text: Their staff is very polite and helpful. They go over and beyond! Thank you for all you do!

name: Chelsi M Lomas
text: Always helpful & friendly staff, clean & organized, great seafood & meat department!

name: Christina Berry
text: They are very nice and I never have to wait long

name: Kara Deal
text: Great food selection. Excellent service.

name: Scott Giddens
text: Good service but produce could be better

name: gary dollar
text: super nice staff and always quick service

name: Ray Fisher
text: A good deal here financially on their promotional generic drugs. You can even get some rx's like Amoxicillin filled free.  Not so good on some drugs.  They are almost $30 per month higher on a family members B.C. pills than our local drug store. In general I am not impressed with their pharmacy staff. On two occassions I or a family member have been given an "off the cuff - whatever" type answer to a technical question.  Their online refill system is not at all user friendly.  If you need something at a particular time you have to call them and talk to a person.  They can ring up your stuff ok but I would not recommend them for any type of discussion on medication details, side effects, alternative options, etc....They give the distinct impression of being too busy to spend time with you! Overall they are OK if you are a knowledgeable shopper but not recommended if you need helpful information.  Shop around for price.  Today they filled one for me when I was in a hurry and when I later had time to check I found it was 16% cheaper at Walmart.

name: Alison Austin
text: This center started out ok but they have some serious management AND customer service issues. I arrived today at 6:55 am and there was already a small crowd as they only had two people working. Dawn setting up beds and Cornelius sticking. Many people in the lobby complained about Cornelius sticking them - and Dawn two blew out my vein(with his assistance) less than a month ago and I agree they are not the best phlebotomists. After two hours, a guy who came in after a large group of us, complained that he had something to do and was taken right to the back... so I complained to dawn that I have things going on today and also would like to go back. She said that she took him to the back because she wasn’t going to lose any donors? I told her everyone saw what happened and in the future would try the same thing. She asked my name and told me if I tried to do that, she’d remember and know I was just trying to skip line. well, she lost me and my husband. There is a waiting list for a reason. Her rude attitude like she is the boss of something has gone to her head. Most of the staff members have the same attitudes. Very few actual “good” employees at this location. Will not be back.

name: Chance Terrell
text: I am a loyal donor for to Talacris plasma center in Phenix City, Al. I am employed and i often have to work til 6pm and it is tough to make it to the center before 6:30. Well Today i made it at exactly 6:30 and the doors were already locked so i walked around to the side door that the donors exit from and tried to speak with one of the managers i had spoken with before in the exact circumstances and he allowed me to donate..... Well in this case today, which is December 15th, i spoke with another gentlman named ELI  and he denied me permission to donate as well as said he was deferring me for my actions. I explained to him  i have a daughter who is 5 years old and i need the $ from my donation for her Christmas i have on layaway. He kept asking my name so he could defer me. I apologized for the way i walked in through the back exit door and explained  That i was just in very much in need of the $. When it comes to my lil girl i do not give up and i will do anything and everything for her. I was never rude but i did not give him my name. I showed him i had $80 in my wallet and let him know i was not one of the drug addicts and desperate for money for dope, but that i was a working father who is doing what he can and would love to see his dauggter happy and excited on Christmas. Though Eli never quit or even thought about changing his mind after i explained what that little but of change they give us for donating meant alot to me. And i apologized sincerely numerous of times. Well as i walked out he said to me. You cant donate today and ill see u again and when i do u will b deferred. It furiated me to the point i dont like. He purposely and willingly stood between me and my lil girls happiness. I find that Eli (the manager) is very unprofessional and is fully taking advantage of his authority. I am wanting the corporate or head offices number. I want to speak with the men or women that is/are Eli's Boss. Thank you.

text: I was there for lab work. 5 stars were earned by my phlebotomist, Breonna. I barely even felt the needle, and she made the whole thing seem pleasant.

name: Ketti Johnson
text: My son had to have blood work drawn last week and was very nervous. The ladies taking care of him were very fun and sweet and made him relaxed. The set-up they have now is very efficient for labs at least. We were in and out in ten minutes tops. I was very impressed.

resp.text: That's great to hear, Ms. Johnson. We're glad to know that our lab team impressed you and put your son at ease. Thank you for trusting us to care for your family.

name: Zack Shields
text:
This review is entirely about the lab services.  I wish we could divide this up, as having one cumulative review summary about the whole mall is not very useful.  For example, if I were going to a normal mall for the Bass Pro Shop, why would I care how good the Bath and Bodyworks or the AMC are?  In the same way here, if I'm going to get my blood drawn, what do I care about how much people like the imaging center?  (It is also kind of funny how it is called a mall.  I imagine going to each "store" and doing their tests as I walk along.)

I was called to the room.  My nurse was quiet, either tired (I came in the evening, so who knows how long she had been on the clock already) or introverted like me.  Certainly not in a cold way.  But she counted down and then inserted the needle, and I barely felt it.  But that's not the amazing part.  I was answering questions for the other nurse in the room (who was super friendly!), and when she found out I was on new insurance, the nurse drawing my blood told me she would need my card.  I was confused because it sounded like they wanted it now, but I was thinking 'Is it safe to reach into my pocket with a needle in my arm?' Then i looked down... She had taken out the needle and bandaged me up without me even noticing.

Unmatched talent.  All I can say. And this is coming from someone who gets his blood tested monthly. I wish I had gotten her name to give her the proper credit and maybe even contact the hospital higher-ups for a formal compliment.  But I will in time... I will be back.

P.s. in terms of wait time, from the time I waited in my car to the time I left was about 20 minutes.

resp.text: Wow, Mr. Shields! This is one of our favorite reviews ever! We are so glad to hear the nurse drawing your blood had such a gentle touch. We sincerely appreciate you taking the time let others know about your experience at Huntsville Hospital Laboratory Services. And you'll be happy to hear that we are in the process of creating separate Google listings for the various services within the Medical Mall.

name: Brittany Hill
text: I went for labs today, Saturday morning,  and checked in on the kiosk at 9:22. The estimated wait time was 50 minutes. I sat down and waited in a full lobby (people were waiting in the hall too). I waited as the workers called people back as quickly as possible. I sat and watched as people went up to the counter, complained about the wait, asked about bills that the workers cannot change or tell them what codes were billed out and help those who were confused about what they needed to do. I sat and watched as all the workers brought patients back with a smile and an apology, “I’m so sorry about your wait”. None of the workers were rude to the patients and they genuinely were doing their very best. I was called back around 10:05 and left at 10:15. The girl who drew my labs was sweet and efficient. They seemed short staffed, but they never let that affect their service.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to let others know about your experience, Ms. Hill. We aim for safe, quality and efficient care with a smile, and we're glad to hear that our staff delivered on all counts. We will pass along your compliments to the team.

name: D Boyd
text:
The medical mall appears poorly organized. I would think this results from inept management. Communication of appointment times is sloppy at best. They allow 30 minutes for paperwork which seems rediculous compared to private medical care facilities managed for efficiency. Overall, I found the staff to be friendly and professional though. Maybe scheduling and administration are understaffed or are working with antiquated systems. The director mentioned in various review responses is probably the root of the problem. The people who work here seem to be trying!
Back 6 months later and nothing has changed. People are nice, but the efficiency and communication is extremely poor. I will seek a different facility for all future tests.

resp.text: We are sorry to hear that you weren't entirely impressed with our staff and sign-in process and will share your suggestions with our management. Your feedback is very important to helping us better meet the needs of our patients.

name: Millicent Smith
text: Every tech, nusre was pleasant. Very instructive, spoke politely. Very happy

resp.text: Ms. Smith, thank you so much for taking the time to leave a review and for the perfect, 5-star rating. We are so happy to hear that you received excellent service and we will pass your comments on to our staff. You will make their day!  Many thanks!

name: anna brooks
text: Waited well over an hour with my husband just too have blood drawn. They just called him back so technically we aren’t even done and we have been checked in for 1 hour and 4 minutes at this point. There aren’t even enough seats to accommodate everyone. Absolutely ridiculous wait time and the waiting room/lab area needs an overhaul to make more room. Will go ANYWHERE but here in the future.

resp.text: We're very sorry for your wait, Ms. Brooks. Your feedback is important to us, and we will make sure the director of that area sees your comments. If you would like to speak with someone about your experience, please call the Patient Advocate at (256) 265-9449. Thank you.

name: Melissa Schlarb
text:
I had an MRI done on Friday at 530. They were quick to call me to the back to prep me. The nurse who put my IV in was horrible!! I bled everywhere. All down my arm. All in the chair. She kept saying I don't know what happened.  She told me when she injected the saline I would taste it or smell it. Yeah I could taste it alright. I tasted blood--How Disgusting!!!! When she went to get me a blanket, I heard her telling another nurse as if she was laughing about it.
During the MRI listening to 104.3 was just horrible I would of rather just listen to the Jack hammer  for 40 mins. I  froze the entire time I was being tested. When it was time to get the contrast the nurse just pulled the bed out of the machine with no warning. I thought I was gonna fall off the bed. I went on a friday evening cause it worked better with my schedule. If these nurses don't like their job or don't want to work fridays maybe they should look for a new profession. I would much rather do my imaging at the hospital and pay a higher copay then deal with their lack of professionalism

name: Robin Phelps
text: My mother and I had a wonderful experience with both registration and imaging staff. My elderly mother believed that she had been scheduled for her test at the Medical Mall, but should have been at the Main hospital. Rachel in registration went out of her way to reassure my mother who was quite upset. She called and worked with the imaging center to get us seen at the Medical Mall and got all of our paperwork quickly taken care of and on to her CT scan. And everyone in the imaging department was also extremely efficient and caring. We will be scheduling all of my mother's appointments here!

resp.text: It so nice to great things about our registration and imaging team members. Thank you for taking time to share your story with us! We will pass your compliments along the appropriate staff.

name: Richard Sullivan
text: The posted opening times are incorrect. I drove to the lab this Thursday at 5:30 am, saw a COVID sign telling me to stay in my car and call. The person who answered said nobody will be there until 6:30am. Site needs to be updated.

resp.text: We apologize for your frustration, Mr. Sullivan. The hours listed on the website are correct. Our Med Mall lab service center staff begins seeing patients at 6 am. We're not sure why you were told otherwise. We strongly encourage patients to schedule their lab appointment in advance by visiting https://www.huntsvillehospital.org/patient-service-center-locations.

name: Sandra Scott
text: Was finally seen to draw blood 2 hrs after time I was told to be there. Many patients in waiting room expressing concern about extremely long wait. They could have at least let us know they were running behind. Will find somewhere else to go next time.

resp.text: Ms. Scott, our team is sorry for the long wait time. Thank you for reaching out to us. We appreciate feedback and use it to improve our services. Your review will be passed along to the Lab leadership team.

name: Joe Hyde
text: Great staff...they really care. The cleaning lady at 1215 on 17 April in the Med Mall lab was a gem. She went and got a coloring book for a crying young girl...amazing. Only issue that could use attention is that at least two patient rooms have wall clocks that need replacing ...correct time in every professional work space contributes to staff efficiency as they do not have to rely on their phone for the time

resp.text: Thank you for the great rating and your kind words, Mr. Hyde. We will pass your comments along to Lab leadership and take a look at those clocks!

name: Daisy
text: Went to Med. Mall to get some blood drawn last week. The young lady that drew my blood was excellent. Her name was Laurrae and she was nice, polite, professional and knew what she was doing. I was kind of leary about going because the last time I went this gentleman used a straight needle and I felt pain in my in my left ac for weeks after that.

resp.text: Hello, Ms. Smith. Thank you for taking time out of your day to share your experience with us. We are happy to hear that it went well. We will share your review with laboratory management.

name: Saundra Handley
text:
If you have the option to go any place else, don’t use this facility. On the first visit we checked in and waited while the waiting room fill up and then emptied.  Two hours after the appointment time, my mother went up to see how much longer it would be. The lady who was filling in while the other lady had gone to lunch, discovered the paperwork that should have been taken to the back, still on the counter. The first lady had also given my mother someone else’s paperwork. Total time there was over 2 1/2 hours for about 15 minutes of work.

The second visit didn’t go much better. The paperwork was taken back this trip but it still took 2 hours past the appointment to be seen. They are clearly booking too many patients for the time they have.  People that came in much later than us were seen and left. There was nothing complicated about what was done so any nurse should have been able to take a blood pressure reading and temperature. I’m not sure why some people are seen ahead of others with appointments that have been waiting hours.

resp.text: Hello, Ms. Handley. We're very sorry to hear about your frustrations and will share your comments with hospital leadership. We hope that you were happy with the care you received once you were seen. If you would like to speak with someone from the hospital, please call the Patient Advocate at (256) 265-9449. The advocate works directly with our medical staff to address concerns raised by patients and family members. Thank you.

name: Susan
text: My husband attempted to drop off a time sensitive sample and no one paid any attention and are now unable to test said sample. This isn't something that can just be done again tomorrow either, multiple days of no activity is required. There were no apologies either. It was almost made like it was my husband's fault. He followed all directions and said they were not even busy.

resp.text: Thank you for reaching out to us. We shared your comments with Laboratory leadership to be sure they are aware of your concerns. If you or your husband would like to speak with someone about the visit, please call our Patient Advocate at (256) 265-9449.

resp.text: Ms. Johnson, businesses do not have the ability to delete Google reviews, so we do not know what happened either. Google does have guidelines for reviews so it's possible something was in violation of their guidelines. There are several departments and businesses within the Medical Mall. Please reach out to the hospital's Patient Advocate at (256) 265-9449 so we may address your concerns with the appropriate department.
