name: Melissa Townsend
text: If I had a choice to put them out of business or give this ER a minus ten, I wouldn't hesitate one minute to do so. I am actually considering starting a blog so the community and guests know how bad this hospital ER and staff really are. They have no idea how to treat patients. When I say "Treat". Not only, do I mean medically, but professionally either. I came in with a true simple condition. I could not get in to see my primary physician until Monday. My visit was Friday night. I was in transition of moving from one state to the other. I brought my current records from my current doctor, the medicine I was taking and EVEN HAD A MEDICAL CARD with all of my info including my picture, birth date, address, leading physician and contact info. Let me say first of all that I have pulmonary embolism. I do take a narcotic for pain management. I had accidently packed my medicine in a box that was meant for me to carry but ended up in the moving van that had not arrived at our new home yet and I was going into severe withdrawals. I had gone 10 days without and  I went in feeling like warmed over death. I presented my ID card, showing when I started my medicines, how many times a day I was prescribed to take it . This included all medicines I was prescribed for PE.( Pulmonary Embolism). I provided and showed the receptionist in highlighted areas exactly what I took. Did I get any blood thinners? No. Did I get something for my GI track? No. Did I get anything for the intense migraine I was suffering? No. Not only did the doctor treat me and talk to me disrespectfully, but so did the nurse. I had to leave the room to get sick where I was sick from both ends. Plus, let me say that my husband said he could hear everything that was coming out from a couple doors down, but so could everyone at the staff desk could hear it too which was emotionally damaging to me. I could not help how I was feeling. That's why I was there. The nurse came back and said "okay, I've got a shot for you!" In a snarky tone. I asked her, what is the shot for? She said. "It's a shot of toridol. " Um ... Toridol? I said. Yes. She said. "The doctor is not putting his licence on the line to help you.". I was so upset and and got up to leave. I let her know that it was quakes like this so called doctor that made people that had real problems go and have to buy drugs off the street because instead of just being honest with the doctor, people have to lie to be able to get the relief that they needed. First of all. When doctors have all the information to see that you are not a drug addict, and you truly came in to get legal compassionate help and choose to degrade you, treat you like you are less then a person especially when you have a life threatening disease.... Those doctors need to have their lisences pulled and they need to find another job where someone else can put up with his snarkiness and disrespectful comments. Him and his little blond nurse. If this is what healthcare for the sick has come to... No wonder why we have such a drug crisis in America. It was all brought on by doctors that didn't deserve to have any lisences of any kind. This hospital should and I will fight with all of my being to have it shut down completely. There is no reason to have a hospital that is not prepared for the patients they have or are soon to come. Shame on this ER. If you have an unfortunate accident, the extra miles to another ER will definitely benefit you more then this bandaid station. That's if they even have those on hand. I plan as of right now to find an attorney, or a group that sheds light on these quack farms. That's exactly what this is. And no one could ever tell me any differently. So if the staff and the board even read these reviews, you had better do something fast before we find a way to shut this POS place down. I will give you another clue... Look how many people put one star as their review. I bet they wished that they had a choice of none or negative stars to rate. I wish i would have checked the reviews before coming in. I would have never come.

resp.text: We strive for good, quality patient care at MCB. If you have a concern, you may call our Quality Department at 344-688-7288.

name: Diamond Mathis
text: I have been in Eufaula for a year and 4 months everytime I have been to this hospital I have been misdiagnosed. I was in excruciating pain Monday 8, 2018 and the doctor Jeffery Reed was one of the most rudest, disrespectful, and very unprofessional doctor. After He diagnoised me I started asking questions trying to figure out how is things possible when he didnt follow up on all the procedures. He started getting smart, catching attitudes, then when I asked for another doctor he lied and said no one else couldnt see me. He then started laughing at me making me feel as if he was picking and being funny saying I just automatically stop crying. I was so furious with him that I wanted another doctor. The nurse that came in said their was someone else who could see me and she didnt know why he told us these things. Then he looked like he was wired on some type of drugs. I have never been treated this way at any other hospital. This is the most ridiculous hospital I have ever been too that can't give no right diagnosis. I just want justice because I felt like he was being racist and not wanting to follow up with procedures due to the lack of insurance and skin color.

name: Francisco F
text: I was there on a Saturday morning and no one in the waiting area I guess that's a good thing. Its a small town compare to Columbus ga. I had a bad reaction to prison ivy on my face and they took me right away no more then ten minutes I had a IV in my arm. They took good care of me. I was there for about one hour. And there were always checking up on how I'm feeling and they paid good attention at my situation. The hospital was about 30 minutes away from my home but it was well worth it. It would have taken me about the same time to go to Columbus ga. I'm glad I made the right choice to go here.

name: Denise Morris
text: I can not say enough good things about the ER at Medical Center Barbour!  My husband and I were passing through Eufaula on our way to Grayton Beach, Fl in our RV.  I had a mishap while going to the back of the camper while in motion, which caused me to cut my leg wide open. With the  assistance from a local Internal Medicine Facillty and EMT's, I was taken to Medical Center Barbour.  I was terrified and had no idea what was going to happen.  We were welcome by several staff members when we arrived.  I was taken straight to a room where Dr. Tony Gabrielson imediatly came in and introduced himself along with several very kind nurses.  They were able to settle me down and feel peace right away.  Claudia the nurse was an angel as well.  Thank you to these fine nurses and Doctor for a job well done! You will never know how much you all meant to me!

name: Johnny Butler
text:
I have been seeing Dr.Go for a many many years. I have always appreciated the way he and his staff takes care of his patients. So yesterday 2/24/2021, I had a problem, post visit with my prescriptions getting filled. Basically the pharmacy didn't have my prescription. So when I used the telephone to call back into the doctors office, I felt like I wasn't going to be able to be helped properly. Not because of unprofessional staff or them having a desire to not help me. But because its a doctors office during a pandemic on top of already taking care of patients.
So I went online and began reading reviews. One response I kept reading was "did you try messaging us on social media or direct thru our website"? So that was what I decided to do. Now it was after 6pm when I messaged and just a few hours later I got a response. You may think getting a response at 9pm seems bad, but let me tell you. When your in need of help, getting a response at 9pm let me know that Go medical is taking care of their patients.
So now here we are at 930am the following morning and my problem has been resolved. Thanks Go medical. I could not be more pleased with your quick help. A million thanks over!
Johnny Butler

resp.text: Thank you.

text: Best staff around. DR. Go is very knowledgeable and has saved my life by accurately diagnosing me, that other doctors from Huntsville had missed. highly recommend him and his staff !

resp.text: Thank you for understanding. We are doing our best despite of this pandemic. Other people think they are the only ones who need care.

name: Miranda McCowan
text:
I’m rating again after having consistent care for 6+ months by Dr Go. In the beginning I was heard, I was treated for my conditions, everything was going fine in my life other than one issue.(5⭐️ then) Until my last appointment, I didn’t even see Dr.Go after being told that’s who I would be seeing that day. I seen a Np that knows NOTHING about me or my conditions & who was rude and kept cutting me off, wouldn’t even listen to what I had to say, She was hateful to me both times I was seen by her. She laughed at my concerns the first time. The second time she treated me like a liar and someone just fishing w/out allowing me to talk to inform her on what Dr. Go and I had discussed about MY issues and what actions we had taken so far. She admitted that she didn’t know what my apt was even for. Dr. Go stopped one RX, that is REALLY dangerous to just quit prescribing to a patient “Cold Turkey.” It states on the FDA website,& medical professionals that tapering IS necessary, I wasn’t tapered at all. I wasn’t I informed at my previous appointment with Dr. Go that I would no longer receive this RX. I didn’t even get my own choice on which I believed my body/mind needed more to have quality of life. Along with the only testing/imaging that was ever ordered was ultrasound and CT which my disease won’t show up on neither one of those as that has been proven by many other medical experts. Nothing further was even discussed to get an accurate diagnoses. Sent me for a CT with dye knowingly that I have a allergy to contrast dye and I had to be treated at the ER because of this and have my husband come 30 miles away to drive me b/c they didn’t check my chart before ordering the scan. Dr. Go has always treated me w/respect and mostly listened to concerns. There was a few times I felt like he was only concerned about a symptom we’ve already discussed when I had multiple concerns that was never addressed. I paid $70 copay to be seen every time besides once therefore I should see Dr. Go. He did help me for 6+ months, especially with my anxiety, etc, but now that my anxiety meds was removed w/o me even being informed my anxiety is @ it’s worse since I lost my dad & two miscarriages this past year. If I was told last month, I could of tapered myself knowing that you need to safely be tapered from any barbiturate. So I felt reeled in at the start. I didn’t break any rules or anything to cause this, either. My first apt I went I was told I would be seeing DR. Go, I didn’t see him that day either. That day was with another NP, Dr. McDaniel, who I DO recommend if you go and have to see a NP. She truly did listen to my concerns and try her best to treat me in the best way allowed, I’d solely give her a star alone, but again I was told by the front that day I’d be seeing Dr. Go & didn't. Normally most DRs would have you come back in two/four weeks to monitor how the meds are working/if they need to be adjusted/changed, to check on how you’re doing with them.  I was really disappointed in the care I received from the office my last visit. I’ve been referring a lot of people to this office, but now I’m unsure if that’s the right thing to do. I truly hope this was just a mistake on the NP side & when I do go back I can see DR GO HIMSELF & discuss options or I will be looking for a different PCP to receive the help to accommodate me. I truly don’t want to do that, but I don’t want to continue to throw away $70 with nothing accomplished, really. MOST of the staff has good bedside manner,a few that could use more discipline as JOKING ab patients after they leave & their private health info is very unprofessional.

•
•

Update: to the response, thank you for replying. I am not meaning my review to be hateful. I’m adding a star since you took the time to look into this for me and replied. I have been satisfied the care I’ve received prior to this day, that’s why I said I didn’t want to change PCP without seeing Dr. Go first to tell him how I am feeling about my last appointment. Hopefully we can get it solved.

resp.text: Will make sure that Dr. Go see you on your next visit. He was swamped with patients that day.

text: Until today my review of Dr. Craig was quite positive.  However the day I was I’m affordably detained on my way to my appointment this resulted in me being 10 minutes late, I did however call before my appointment time to tell them I had been delayed. I did not know I needed to get a name of the person I spoke to. By the time I was able to check in because I had to stand in line to use their kiosk to check in I was right at 15 minutes late. I was then told that Dr. Craig had a strict 15 minute no-show rule. This resulted in having to reschedule my appointment after I had driven 20 miles to get here and now I have to return in the morning. I have waited much longer than 15 minutes after my appointment time on occasion and yes I was very irritated when I was told there was no grace available.

text: I was referred to Dr Craig for a tendon injection which I had yesterday. Waiting and hoping this is going to relieve the pain I have been in for months. He was just so kind in making sure he wasn’t hurting me. The RT working with him was awesome. There was a third person in the room she just stood back and said nothing. Would like to have known what her purpose was. I would recommend Dr Craig in a heartbeat.

text: Dr. Craig takes the time to make sure I understand the underlying problem and gets to the main objective which is what's causing my pain and this is how we fix it! I appreciate how I I never have to wait long in the treatment room or waiting room! His office is run efficiently! I would highly recommend him!!

text: Office personnel were very efficient and courteous. Dr Craig and nurse practitioner were very concerned and reviewed my case and helped me to make a decision on my treatment!
